1.title: Simple Pleasures
1.description: It’s a hot summer’s day, so why not step outside?

author_commentary.veronica:
Heyyyyyyyy everybody! Here’s the start of the comic!
The BCB archive has undergone a lot of reworking over the years, and what you’re seeing here (and afterward) is the final result of edits, redraws and recolourings for the Bittersweet Candy Bowl Omnibus. This comic is as polished as it can be now, a balance of the simplicity and charm of the old art but a whole lot less scribbly.
The “first posted” dates reflect the original version of the chapter, but the first 850 pages were all enhanced in 2020.
So to all new readers, welcome! I hope you enjoy your stay!
author_commentary.oliver: Indeed — it took a lot of time but we’re really happy with the result! Have fun!

author_commentary.veronica: Sure is a quiet neighbourhood. Oh those middle-class cats.
Just kicking my friends in the face who come up from behind me, no big deal! Daisy is too lovesick to care.

Paulo is a very rude dude! “This time”? You dare blame your oblivious, dopey friend for your sins?
In other news oh my god it’s a stream what does that mean etc etc etc
There he is!

And so it begins…
The original first 40-or-so chapters were drawn on lined paper in pencil in a grid comic format. You’ll see in the pages to continue the fully-redrawn pages from this format. I wanted to keep the style nostalgic and simple while also giving it a bit of modern appeal.
I really like the pink colour scheme, rose-tinted you might say…
Anyway, thanks for reading!!

2.title: Gaming Rivalry
2.description: A simple video game competition leads to an all-out brawl.

author_commentary.veronica:
this ain’t an easy thing to do / my stats will suffer just for you / we can live the dream if you / if you be my player two
Honestly I don’t blame Lucy for mastering a move that allows you to explode your enemy immediately.

Wow, a dramatic flashback to how Lucy got her bow! Does this mean one day we’ll find out how Mike got his scarf?!?!?!?!?!?!?
…
Maybe some day!
Originally Lucy’s bow was given to her as a way to “validate” her femininity, which is honestly kind of a lame message! So in the new version of this chapter, Lucy’s mother has given Lucy her bow instead to show her love and support. A much healthier parental move than “You’re not predisposed to what society deems feminine? Well, you’ll come around to it because you’re a girl!”

Mike’s really testing her limits here!
Lucy never has to reimburse Mike for the broken ceilings, she and Mike’s family simply have some killer home insurance!

If only the comic didn’t take place in 2006, Mike coulda referenced Twilight Princess!! But he had to reference a more niche kind of horse game. At least you know Mike is a cool kid with wide knowledge of video games.
Thanks for reading!

3.title: Merry Snow Day
3.description: Snowfall in the morning, but is it enough to grant Lucy a day off school?

author_commentary.veronica:
How good were snow days, everyone?? It was something I was always really excited for, even though school was only a 10 minute walk from home.
Lucy was often in my situation where I hoped the overnight snow was enough to close the schools, but nope, not always. Those damn snow plows clearing up the roads in the early morning… blocking me (and her) from freedom.
author_commentary.oliver: As an Australian, this is completely foreign to me. I think it’s from cartoons. What’s snow?

author_commentary.veronica:
I like that David is doing a sit-in… in the middle of nowhere. Not even in front of the school! You know a teacher would only encourage him to get up and get inside… where it’s warm.
You know what she likes!!!!!

Good ol’ Yashy, saying what certain people are actually thinking, even when it’s better not to voice it…
She always takes the fall from readers for being too rude but there’s a reason Lucy gets very flustered by what Yashy says… and it’s not because Lucy thinks Yashy’s being wrong…
Regardless, learn some tact you damn child!!!
author_commentary.oliver: Yashy motivates us all to do better.

author_commentary.veronica:
This page was based off of an old comic I wrote long long ago, before “Bittersweet Candy Bowl” was a thing. I wanted to draw Lucy doing more stunts, but had limited space to do it, here.
Sadly, Lucy never got the wonderful snow day she wanted ;\_\_; Better luck next time!

4.title: Unfit for Education
4.description: Yashy thinks she’s old enough to be taught, but things aren’t always so easy for a pet.

author_commentary.veronica: I had a bit of a weird time trying to decide which grade I should place the characters in at the beginning of the series. Eighth grade was my eventual choice, but at this stage, their grade was kind of irrelevant. This lead to some confusion about Yashy’s age, but it’s all worked out these days. SHE’S FOUR.

THIS IS SEWIOUS.
Though, yeah, probably not worth thinking too much about the morality of holding a conscious hamster in a cage and keeping the four-year-old lizard-blob out of school.
I love how I made Mike a giggling fool throughout this sequence. He doesn’t seem to know fear yet…

Hey, some evidence these comics were made during the time I was studying for my psychology final! I drew this comic specifically because I was reading about obsessive-compulsive disorder, and the exercise about polar bears was brought up more or less like this. I imagine Sue being the type to stay up all night reading books that caught her interest — like me reading about various mental illnesses to this day lol
Anyway, Mike couldn’t get away for too long…

5.title: The Burden of Parenthood
5.description: The students pair up to care for electronic infants, leading to some shocking results.

author_commentary.veronica:
Ah, The Burden of Parenthood. This was one of my most popular chapters back in the day so I decided to redraw it in 2010 when we were preparing our first book, Volume One. Now it’s been edited again to fit cleanly in the Omnibus! So many evolutions.. I swear this Omnibus project is the last of them!
See, when you get married, you become immune to disease and pregnancy. It’s the ultimate contraceptive!
Final panel makes me laugh so much, Yashy completely doesn’t understand (as she shouldn’t, honestly)
author_commentary.oliver:
Damn. Definitely don’t get gonorrhea.
These proper-panelled chapters were harmonised with the grid ones, using this new scheme! It’s a little different. We also touched it up with distinct border colours and a distinct foreground and background. The whole point was to make the archive a lot more stylistically coherent — I sure hope it worked!

author_commentary.veronica:
Paulo is so suave and fast, Lucy didn’t even realise Mike was off his seat!
I do like how the babies are dumped in some sort of wheelbarrow, being carried like manure.

Yashy is so rude and I love it. Clever, too, because the name she’s offering rhymes with Alegria! What a smart gal.
Mike needs to be a better father!
author_commentary.oliver: A face only a mother could love.

author_commentary.veronica:
Paulo and Lucy are really hitting it outta the park with their emulation of modern relationships, amirite?!?!!?!?!?!?!?!?!? harrdeeharrharr.
I really love Paulo dramatically demanding they make it work, though.. Paulo’d be perfect for a soap opera actor.

Aww, Paulo looks so proud of how he’s holding Lucy’s baby! Lucy has clearly had a lot of practice handling babies considering.. well, Yashy.
Mike clearly insinuating he would not be a good father to an ugly baby >8U We know who’s the better dad here.

I remember being really heartbroken when my teacher took my robot baby away, too. I kind of really hoped she would let me keep it! A COMPLETELY IMPOSSIBLE SCENARIO, OF COURSE, but I dunno, you kinda hope stupid impossible things as an idealistic 16 year old!
Maybe she’ll see my face looking very sad and know this baby should be left with me permanently, why wouldn’t she think differently???
Anyway, I feel you Paulo.
Farewell, Alegria…

6.title: Flying Lessons
6.description: Yashy recalls her first meeting with Chirpy.

author_commentary.veronica:
“Flying Lessons” is a reworking of a chapter made for the original run of BCB comics on DeviantArt. When BCB was moved to its own site and chapters were redrawn aand reshuffled for the 2011 publication of Volume One, this chapter, called “Chirpy’s Introduction” back then, didn’t make the cut. But now it’s back and BETTER THAN EVER!!! It returns with a vengeance.
So much roughhousing!!
author_commentary.oliver:
This chapter taught me one of those grammatical lessons that takes forever to force into your brain for some reason — how to capitalise mom! You see, it’s lower case if you’re talking about moms as a concept, but Mom if you’re using it as a name for your choice of mom. Easy!
If I made a mistake and printed thousands of books with the mistake in it, please don’t tell me about it.

author_commentary.veronica:
Another reason this chapter was originally omitted from the 2011 book was because Yashy initially acted like a certain copyrighted dinosaur… and that was particularly egregious here.
But by the time I redrew this chapter, Yashy had fully settled into the role of a vague lizard-creature that simply LOOKS like a certain copyrighted character, to the point Lucy named her after them, but isn’t *actually* them. Either way, no ability to save that baby egg by shooting your tongue out, Yashy!
author_commentary.oliver:
It just kinda got weird, didn’t it! When a character does some strange things that never come back again later in the comic. I actually spent a bit of time going through all the rejected chapters of yore and I really wanted to rescue this one, as it helps us understand where Chirpy came from and it has a lot of charm!
So it’s a good thing baby Yashy had her redemption moment here. Go you little lizard thing.

author_commentary.veronica:
Has anyone else tried to hatch an egg before? I remember taking a chicken egg when I was 5 and trying to incubate it by keeping it warm, but I think it was one of those eggs that didn’t have a baby inside and was purely for consumption. That’s how they’re sold in stores, right? I recall that’s what my father told me when he decided enough was enough and he needed to BREAK MY RESOLVE.
But it’s okay because I was 5 and I got distracted by something else soon after. At least Yashy got to live my dreams!
author_commentary.oliver: Cheep cheep cheep’s the name of her soul.

author_commentary.veronica:
Mike you have GOT to chill
Anyway, little cute Chirpy backstory done! Yay! See you next chapter!

7.title: Prom Preparation
7.description: Daisy is put in charge of the 8th-grade dance night, while Mike takes on the role of ladies’ man.

author_commentary.veronica:
This is the first comic I drew on a completely new notebook, dedicated to BCB. This could also be seen as the first comic where I decide to put more effort in.. and also the first comic where I decided that this series will officially be a running one, and not just one-offs. By this time, I was putting in little bits of information I hadn’t thought about previously.. like their ages, their grade, the works. The only possible inaccuracy at this point is characters heights. Ah well!
“Flea fetish” makes me laugh a lot.
author_commentary.oliver:
Fun fact! This is the oldest BCB page we still have an original of. The older grid pages before it were damaged and thrown out in a flood! All that remained were very low quality scans from 2006… which until this total remaking, were upsampled and cleaned up as best we could.
Now it’s all fresh! And we’re in a new era of multi-chapter plot development. How thrilling!

author_commentary.veronica:
Oh, that Daisy. When is she not pining like a tree.
Yashy is SO possessive of Mike and I always kinda found that dynamic charming.. Yashy is a total meanie to “Flea”, but deep down, she loves him and doesn’t want anyone else taking him away. It’s not THAT kinda love, of course, Lucy is being actively obtuse and rude >8(

Mike’s gaggle of crushes is meant to be more of a running joke rather than the girls being madly in love specifically with him. So if he’s to find a permanent partner, the majority of his fangirl squad wouldn’t kill themselves or anything. They’ll be a bit sad, but it’s not the end of the world! It’s all just crushes! Sue and Amaya will be okay! They just like to think about him sometimes, you know?
One feature I’ve always hated in other stories is characters who are all too perfect.. gorgeous looks, perfect athletes, just overall loved by all. It’s surprising how I didn’t realise for a long time that Mike was drifting into this category. He’s the fastest runner, he’s considered handsome, he’s a real nice guy to boot.. and he’s got his team of adoring fangirls to back it up.
Over time this perfect character has become one of the most controversial characters in the comic for.. reasons you’ll see! But as of right now, there’s not much to complain about when it comes to Mike!
Other than his height lol
author_commentary.oliver: But you see, that just makes him cuter!

author_commentary.veronica:
The Burden of Parenthood will forever haunt Paulo… he cannot escape the power of Alegria.
Paulo was polyamory-friendly before it was cool.

8.title: Helping Hands
8.description: When disaster strikes a poor little bird, Paulo and Daisy are eager to help.

author_commentary.veronica:
This was an original chapter dreamed up for Volume One when it was first printed. It’s such a cute story, though, so I’m happy it’s been immortalised on the site and not exclusively in print!
Anyway, it’s good to see Paulo be so realistic.. like yeah, sucks that the poor bird was run over, but better for it to be dead than suffering, right? Might as well!!!!
author_commentary.oliver: In a world of sentiment birds, I think I might be more like Daisy than Paulo here. How horrible!

author_commentary.veronica:
Paulo was seriously going to let a little bird get run over by a car if not for Daisy pitching a fit about it, goodness gracious what a Darwinist!
He saved the bird, though!!! That’s what truly counts, right???

How funny is it for Paulo to ask if there’s a hospital nearby? I guess it would sound weird for the cat to ask if there’s a vet nearby… but does that mean hospitals help feral birds…
let’s just.. not think about it.

I wonder if down the road Paulo would be the kinda guy to have like.. ten cats.
.. Though I guess in BCB universe, that’s like, ten birds. Or ten hedgehogs??? I don’t even know, I need to not entertain the thought. I don’t want to be forced to make lore.

The reveal… of fluffy Daisy.
Or, rather, frizzled. Fortunately Paulo thinks she looks kinda cute.
author_commentary.oliver: Frizzled AND frazzled! Poor girl.

author_commentary.veronica:
Daisy, you need to learn to love yourself!!
Also, yes, there seems to be issues with wounded birds during a rainstorm! I wonder what other event Lucy is referring to!! Maybe we will find out some day!!
Lucy’s not letting Paulo and Daisy encroach on her Mike time… nosuree, you guys can stay out.

Around the latter-half of this page, I was able to get my hands on an inkbrush and lord does the lineart look/feel SO GOOD after that. It was around panel 8 that I made the switch, what a big difference. So whippy and effortless, as opposed to drawing over the line multiple times with pens.

What’s with these proper-panelled older chapters being about Paulo and Daisy????? Because they have cool meaningful adventures together, THAT IS WHY.
Thanks for reading!!!!

9.title: Show and Tell
9.description: The gang talks about their breeds while certain other misconceptions are thrown out the window.

author_commentary.veronica:
New chapter!! With some LORE??? POSSIBLY?????
Somebody suggested I make panel fifteen into a wallpaper once. I still don’t know if I should and if I decide to, HOW to do it. It’s a cute scene, though. Mike is so playful. They really have a cute dynamic together.

HERE IS THE LORE… more information on Lucy’s partial deafness!
I really appreciate how this trait that happens to white-furred-blue-eyed cats allowed me to do research on partial deafness and what partially deaf people go through.. it’s something that’s explored more clearly in future chapters. Meanwhile right now it’s something Lucy doesn’t get into much. During the rewrite of the comic I tried to be more conscious about it, because in the past I honestly would forget!!
But it’s quite intentional when you see people care about her partial deafness, and who is actually considerate to it, keep a watchful eye..
For those who don’t get the apple reference, think Snow White and soon you’ll understand.

Want to know a silly fact? Mike was actually SUPPOSED to be a Russian Blue at first! But after a little more time surfing through pages and looking at cat breeds (I was trying to attach breeds to the other characters), I came across Korats.. and I thought Korats were A LOT more appropriate a breed for Mike. Korats even have really sensitive hearing.. so yeah.. but by the time I thought that was more fitting, page three was done, dialogue and all. So I erased the dialogue on a few panels and rewrote it. Thank god I drew with pencils!
Obviously, this nugget of information is outdated because then I went ahead and digitally redrew/rewrote all these pages, but it reflects the stage the comic was in about here. Figuring all this stuff out as I went!
Also, Daisy is the most adorable character ever. Although I feel bad because Ragamuffins are said to be particularly big cats.. and Daisy’s really small. IT’S HER REX TAKING CHARGE, that’s why she’s so small. Yeah.. YEAH. Perhaps her growth spurt will come soon…

This last page shows off the fact that Paulo is actually meant to be really handsome.. in that scruffy kinda way. That’s why all the girls start gawking at him.. even Yashy who tries her best not to let it get to her.
.. But then he’ll open his mouth and it’ll remind Lucy that he’s a guy worth punching. Mike’s relieved Lucy’s back on earth, at least!
author_commentary.oliver: The throwaway nature of the final panel here always makes me laugh. Now you know!

10.title: Gone Fishing
10.description: During a field trip to the aquarium, Paulo almost becomes fish food.

author_commentary.veronica:
Whoo hooooo, it’s another book-exclusive chapter that has now made its way to the website!! I really liked this chapter and felt sad you could only get it if you purchased the book. (Though if you did purchase the book, thank you so much~!!!! You’re all awesome!!)
But it’s here now for EVERYONE to see!!!
Anyway, let’s explore some of Lucy’s lesser-talked-about traumas.

In the rewrite/redraw, I wanted Paulo to still be slimy and grabby, but not to the extent of being an inexcusable sexual-assaulter, so his actions have been toned down throughout the comic, for the better.
He’s still being annoying and hugging Lucy when she doesn’t want him to, but now you think he’s a prick that needs to get better at boundaries, rather than irredeemable.
author_commentary.oliver: Some things that make sense as an extreme anime-style joke get kind of confusing when the characters are fleshed out later! So enjoy a comic where the things that are happening have the correct weight.

author_commentary.veronica: I do like how this chapter does a lot of foreshadowing. Unfortunately you won’t get all the answers here!!! But if you stay tuned… you will…
author_commentary.oliver: This will forever be memorable to me as an example of how converting to vertical “Webtoon” format can be a nightmare — look at Lucy’s covered face in the first panel! And these were all inked so there’s NO face behind that bubble. But we did it in the end.

author_commentary.veronica: Daisy is so awful here lmao. Get some self-respect, girl!
Lucy hitting her where it hurts, I guess both physically and mentally this time. Very rude!

Bonding through bad experiences, can you hear wedding bells????
Anyway, that’s all!!! A pretty chill chapter that sets a few questions up that will answered in time!

11.title: Pep Rally
11.description: Mike’s hypersensitivity to noise and the upcoming pep rally make for a dangerous combination.

author_commentary.veronica:
Pep rallies! What an exciting time! I barely remember them these days, but I assure you that they were VERY important!!
And loud, don’t forget loud.
Which doesn’t sound too pleasant for our sensitive little protagonist!!
author_commentary.oliver: For those who don’t know, a pep rally is a kind of rah-rah school gathering where everybody cheers on the sports teams. I barely understood! But now I do. I think I’d wanna skip it too.

author_commentary.veronica:
I am still amused at the poster in the first panel. I always like when I have a chance to put some goofy posters on the wall, some easter eggs old readers appreciated. Though it’s not really an easter egg if it’s just there right in front of you, right?
Some notable background characters in this page, including the debut of the mysterious and wonderful flower girl!!

In the original version of this page, Lucy asked Mike what was bothering him, which seemed very silly to me because, come on, she’s known him for so many years! Of course she’d know he’s sensitive to sound! It is literally something they coulda bonded over, given she’s deaf in one ear!
I made it so Yashy asked the question instead, since I can see her overlooking things like that. She gets to be the reader stand-in for now.
I also feel like because Lucy is half-deaf, she’d be too busy getting disoriented by all the sounds around her. The background would be too noisy and chaotic for her to be able to properly focus. We’re all suffering here!

C’mon, sex-ed teacher, you’re off the clock now! Relax!!
Lucy’s competitive spirit can be easily drawn out.

I remember being so proud of this page.. especially how bold and scribbly it got. There were some chalkier-feeling pencils I used that made me able to do that.. so I tried to emulate that look in the digital version! It was certainly fun to try and recapture the chaos!

I loved this page, too. Mike gets so epic-looking and it’s further showing how bloody good of an athlete he is. No wonder Lucy always wants to compete and beat him!
And that’s the end of that chapter, too!

The best of them, tougher than leather.
I remember when I first made this chapter, I just wanted Yashy to walk in and recite these stupid Sonic Adventure lyrics, but I didn’t know what to do after that so I got Mike and Lucy to just decide to go to the movies! And then CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT HAPPENED…
Even the more important stories can start from a goofy meme.
author_commentary.oliver: I’m Mike, the Yashy defender.

author_commentary.veronica:
Time for some conflict!
I was told that Mike was particularly stupid to take Daisy’s offer considering how Lucy OBVIOUSLY just wanted to be with him.. but Mike just isn’t the type to really back away from his friends.. and this was a bit of a surprise to him. I feel it all panned out well..
Also, if he were to have refused, Paulo woulda popped in with a “YOU WANNA BE WITH YOUR LOVER HUH” comment.. which woulda ruined everything. Lucy woulda probably kicked Mike in the face and rushed off in embarrassment.. so it worked out for the best. Lucy is feeling particularly vulnerable here.

This movie is a big franchise, covering many different themes and genres. An ever-evolving enigma.
An underrated masterpiece of collaborative effort!!!!!

I really love how Mike is actively trying to have an intelligent conversation about this stupid-ass movie while everyone else ignores the hell out of him. Even DAISY is ignoring him when it’s totally her jam to talk tons about a movie after seeing it!
I guess she and Mike were about to have a conversation until she noticed Paulo dwelling on the “deep” storyline.

My original plan for this page was to foreshadow these bullies as characters who appear later in the comic and affect the main character’s lives considerably.
It has since been rewritten to some jerkass bullies who never see Paulo again because Paulo lived in the city as a kid! They just happened to scar him for life!
The world is not full of constant coincidences, and I think at the time I was trying super hard to intertwine story elements. I find that embarrassing in retrospect. Imagine having some bullies be so hyperfixated on a five-year-old child enough to remember him later! Very silly!

Daisy seems to like when Paulo is a polite, nice sensitive person. Why isn’t he like this more often????
Anyway, SIKE. Lucy is a scoundrel.
author_commentary.oliver: Aw, rats!

author_commentary.veronica: Something’s going on with these guys, I can’t exactly put my finger on it.
author_commentary.oliver: Occasionally we’ll have “intermissions” like this — cute little mostly-comedic stories. But don’t skip ’em, you’ll miss out on puns like these!

author_commentary.veronica:
When I first drew this chapter, I was told that Paulo looked.. different.. and yeah, he does.. since he’s wet. That’s why his whiskers are hanging down, due to the weight of the droplets. I feel this actually encouraged me to make Paulo’s whiskers stick out more.. if you look at really old comics, he doesn’t have those really sprout out at all.
(Not as relevant anymore given these pages are redrawn so Paulo’s whiskers are always included — Unless I make a mistake. But an interesting factoid of the past I want to keep in this commentary!)

13.title: Puppy Love
13.description: A secret admirer leaves a note for Mike, amusing Lucy to no end.

author_commentary.veronica:
Ahh, more demonstration of Mike as a hot commodity. Lucy is particularly cruel here, since the letter seems sincere. Poor Stacy :'(
I don’t think Lucy would ever be caught dead writing a sappy letter like that.

I will always be in love with panel seventeen, it was an expression from the original page that I wanted to preserve in this redrawing. I think I was able to recapture it well!!!
I like how Daisy just.. shows up. Followed by Paulo and David. They really orbit around Mike and Lucy a lot!

Katie only really likes Mike because that’s a popular thing to do, I don’t think she’s capable of genuine emotion.
Very rude, Lucy!!!

I was never a fan of that sorta stereotype — if a guy is liked by many, he’s considered a pimp. I thought it was if the guy went around CONTROLLING the girls or something! That’s why Mike gets so furious.
So yeah.. all in all a lighthearted comic.. quite a shift coming up next.

14.title: Confrontation
14.description: Finding themselves lost in an unfamiliar city, the group faces up to some troublesome characters.

author_commentary.veronica:
Oh boy.. here is this chapter. The chapter that changes the dynamic of everything.
This one certainly creates some ripples for the future!! Anyway, let’s go.
Sue just wants to go home, she ain’t needing no drama llamas.

It’s funny that Lucy asks Sue to call her mother, what about YOUR mother Lucy?? What about MIKE’S mother? Why not anyone else’s mother??
I guess it would be weird for Sue to call anyone else’s mother but her own, as it seems Sue wants to be the leader of the party. So it’s YOUR mother you need to call, Sue! Even though Lucy’s mother is a housewife so she has all the time in the world to take a two-hour drive out!
author_commentary.oliver: Poor Daisy. She’s bearing her heart right here! But Mike’s not interested.

author_commentary.veronica:
Paulo and Daisy having a bonding moment over their respective thirsts.
But the area is quiet enough for Lucy to have mostly heard all of that!!!!! whoops!!!!

Mike you are such an oblivious SUBURBAN WHITE BOY. How could you even remotely think this is a good idea!
Nice of the bartender to not immediately kick the kids out given they’re absolutely 100% underage, but maybe kicking them out would have prevented what’s going to happen.

Athletic super-runner Maishul has the stamina of a little canary when it comes to the alcoholic candy, I suppose.
I wouldn’t be surprised if he ate the wrappers as well.
ANYWAY THIS IS ALL YOUR FAULT MIKE!!!!

Daze sure is down in the dumps.
I’ve always thought Paulo would be the type to give Daisy that kind of nickname, but I never thought it looked right in writing.. sounds like a bit of an insult, huh? “Daze” makes me think, like, dumb and oblivious, and Daisy is certainly not dumb. Maybe oblivious, but not dumb at all!
Either way, I guess Mike’s amazing hearing didn’t pay off this time!!! You didn’t have to be so dumb!

Since the original Confrontation (a grid comic, but replaced even before Volume One was published) was basically half as long as this new version, does this mean we’re technically on page four? Proper panels sure make sequences longer.
It’s interesting how the grid format means A LOT of story can be told, but there’s so many cool things you can do with proper panels! I guess there’s sacrifices all-around, but I don’t regret eventually switching to proper panels. Makes things much cleaner and helps with pacing and helps with making certain scenes feel more important.
Anyway.. uhh.. these guys.

Poor Mike, he is all “doip to the doip doip”
Honestly, these guys just wanted to hassle these kids in the bar. They didn’t expect Mike to go to where they were hanging out and BREAKING THEIR STUFF. What bad luck!!! Maybe don’t leave your radio playing next time, dumbass!

Remember “Off to the Movies” and how I said there were originally some bullies that somehow remembered the tiny kid they bullied? Well, that’s no longer the case here. Paulo just developed a bark-phobia.
Paulo and this guy have never met before! Initially I DID plan for these guys to be the bullies Paulo met in the city as a child, but that’s absolutely ridiculous, isn’t it? Why would these guys care so much about a child???? Paulo’s not special, Mike isn’t special, none of these kids are special!
There was meant to be another character that would give these evil guys the information so they’d know about the character’s weaknesses, but again, why make all that effort? Why do these kids MATTER?
So instead, the barker just thought to bark to scare them off, not realising he was actually triggering someone’s bonafide phobia. What an (un)lucky break!
author_commentary.oliver: Twenty bucks! I’d want to keep it too.

author_commentary.veronica:
BARK BARK BARK BARK
nice try at being the voice of reason, Sue.

Man poor Sue, she just wanted to get her paper done and get home safe. Why do you guys always RUIN EVERYTHING for her??
Even as a dumb drunk, Mike is a firecracker.

HEADBASH
too slow sucka

DONDE ESTA LUCY?????
there she is
im in ur alleyway, lowerin ur sperm count

Lucy, you’re getting pretty unoriginal with your attacks!
She’s like those gamers that spam an unfair move on the opponent when playing fighter games. Then again there is the disadvantage that she’s so tiny.. so where else can she aim? She’s doing the best with her abilities.
Anyway uhh dude that is a child

I kept thinking to myself that it’s a cliché to have a character not realise someone is sneaking up behind them.. considering Lucy did that to the goon before.. but the funny thing is Lucy is half-deaf so she genuinely wouldn’t have heard the guy coming towards her!!!!! Maybe you shoulda finished the job, Lucy!!
To be fair to her, she kicked the other guy and he was DONE. Lucy couldn’t predict the second time he’d be so.. stubborn.

WHOOP THERE SHE GOES
You can do it, Lucy!!!

Daisy’s role: to scream out people’s names every few pages.
I think she should win an Emmy for this kind of performance.
Anyway come on Daisy, you’re a CHEERLEADER. You can LIFT OTHER PEOPLE. Do something!!
(I mean that jokingly because Daisy is obviously paralysed in fear and people have different ways of reacting to terrifying situations, which this honestly is.)
author_commentary.oliver: It’s not good, is it?!

author_commentary.veronica:
JUST DUST YOSELF OFF AND TRY AGAIN
i love how deranged I made Lucy look in the second to last panel. she is like a mother cat trying to protect their baby, only she’s more trying to protect her kawaii bestie.
Mother cats are pretty badass, I read stories about how a mother cat would survive a fight and be all tattered and bruised.. but the kittens would be perfect and bouncing around.
jesus christ
this guy sure is having a kick the dog moment

Well SOMEONE had to do something!!! Even if he’s still off his face in chocolate liqueurs.
Thank you for coming back to us, Mike!! Though your skull was seconds away from getting cracked!!!!
GIRL-HITTING IS NOT COOL.
author_commentary.oliver: He’s right, you know!

author_commentary.veronica: tag-teamin’
Sorry, Mike. You can kill another day!
NNGGHGHH STOP SNUGGLING ME JERKFACE
author_commentary.oliver: I don’t think they’d want to let the parents know exactly what kind of chaos they just got into. After all, they made it out fine… right?

author_commentary.veronica:
“You shoulda saved some for me!!“
I wanted David to say that after the “wow” in the final panel, but I obviously couldn’t fit that in. I definitely wanted to say more, imagine if David was there. I think he would have actively tried to stop things! Even David won’t be goofy in every situation!
Anyway Paulo you’re RUDE

Lucy, you almost had a chance.. Mike was giving you so many chances.. why did you not trust him..
I mean, there’s a reason she doesn’t trust him. You just DON’T KNOW IT YET.
victory kissu~~~!!

And that’s the end of that! Silly tsundere Lucy YOU BASICALLY WROTE YOUR FUTURE NOW.
It’s not like she was ready, though, and I mean, they’re all still silly little kids!

15.title: Aftermath
15.description: Despite a lucky escape, mixed messages leave Mike with an awful taste in his mouth.

author_commentary.veronica:
It’s obvious that there needed to be a continuation to Confrontation, at least to build on the cliffhanger between Mike and Lucy.. like what’s to happen? They revert back to normal or what? Surely what just happened is going to change everything.
Of course, knowing Mike, he was definitely gonna be consumed with constant thoughts even though Lucy explicitly told him not to think too much about it.
author_commentary.oliver: “Think I’d follow your dumb rules, jerk?!” is a particularly cute Lucy moment here. He dreams her up like the real thing!

author_commentary.veronica:
Mono is a kissing disease, for those unaware! I’m sure it has a better, more official label, but I always heard it being referred to as “mono” when I used to go to school.
Oh, that sex-ed teacher. When is she not ready to kill Mike.

Hey, the English teacher goes back to math! Maybe she was meant to be a math teacher afterall and my old self really WAS being consistent..
In all honesty, this teacher was a teacher I used to draw a lot just because I liked her design, so it didn’t matter what subject she was teaching, I just wanted to draw her!! Maybe she’s versatile and does multiple subjects.. what a catch.
More demonstration of Mike’s supernatural hearing abilities.. if only he could stick to listening to whispers instead of random radios beside trash cans.
In the original version of these comics, I had a habit of making Lucy’s nose disappear since her nose is red.. not black like the majority of the other characters. Everyone else HAS to have a nose visible, but Lucy’s nose always has to be uncoloured, so it became a habit where I removed it entirely.
In the old series, I used to specifically draw her uncolored nose, but it used to come out looking really big compared to the others.. so for cuteness factor, I used to not have her with the nose.. and that trait became necessary for anyone who had a red nose.. it just shouldn’t be drawn unless the character specifically had a big nose.
Good thing I later started giving her the nose again and fixed the issue entirely in the remake.. I feel she looks weird without one now.

Bully and harass your love interest so they stop being interested in you, very smart move Lucy!!!!!
Anyway all that conflict sorted out and fixed into a neat little bow!!!!!

16.title: Field Day
16.description: Outdoor games are fun for everybody, right? Well, unless you take them a little too far…

author_commentary.veronica:
If “Pep Rally” had an older sister, it’s definitely this chapter. For a while, I was wanting to dedicate a chapter to a field day.. which, for those who don’t know, is a school event where everyone is sent outdoors and they do dozens of sports-related activities. Some people race, some throw little hoop-thingies onto a cone.. or some just blow it off and polish their nails. Whichever comes naturally.
Daisy is cheerful as always, and Paulo is showing more of that “Ohoho, I am being a badass, but oh wait a wild Daisy approaches better not be that way” characteristic.. that kind of vulnerability doesn’t always happen. Paulo normally acts like himself even with Daisy around.. but there are those moments where he gets particularly self-conscious.
I used to make a lot of references to Di Gi Charat.. that’s where I got the “Ayu beeeeem” from.

I like that Lucy is having a casual conversation with Katie as she tries to hurt Mike, good thing Mike can take care of himself.
Katie is the tragic result of American sex education.
David is good at every sport, he might just not be playing the one you want at any given time!

It’s nice when you see Mike with a backbone! There are times where he isn’t all humble and timid and going with the flow, it’s not just Lucy who is the competitive one! Mike can definitely become pretty merciless when provoked.. though the word that needs to be stressed is “provoked."
And Lucy sure likes doing a lot of that!
At least you still stand a chance, Lucy, unlike Yashy and Blur!

GO GET EM, LUCY!!!!
When I initially made this page, I was taking a ton of inspiration from Azumanga Daioh. The running pose in panel six referenced Sakaki pretty directly!
FINISH :D
I like that Paulo is focusing on Lucy’s breathing as opposed to Katie being drenched in mud.

Katie is in the worst physical situation imaginable! This is why she likes to make excuses in order to sit out and do her nails instead.
It’s funny how Katie is complaining and Mike/Lucy decide to completely ignore her and go back to arguing amongst themselves. True friends right there.

Paulo, just be quiet dude!!!!
Mike is a kind and patient partner for sports, though not for long if Lucy is gonna keep pushing his buttons..
author_commentary.oliver: Blur’s “It’s been over!” is another one of my fav silly lines. Had to preserve it from the original.

author_commentary.veronica:
Paulo is just living life right now, yet again too distracted by Lucy to realise Katie is, once again, covered in mud.
Mike is so cool lmao

People probably think Lucy’s “Hap!” is a misspelling of “Hah!”.. but it isn’t. I keep thinking Lucy might make slightly “Amy Rose” sounds.. and I’ve heard her go “Hap!” in Sonic Adventure before.. which is cute and just SHUTTUP I’M NOT A WEABOO ;\_\_; IT’S JUST A SOUND EFFECT GOD.
Mike and Lucy are psyching themselves out so much they’re playing exactly the same! Meant to be..

Oh, that lifesaving Maishul~~~
Lucy and Mike actually start daydreaming the scene that starts on panel twelve and goes to panel sixteen.. it looks like it ACTUALLY HAPPENED, but it didn’t. You can see the thought bubble.. but I’m just making it clear for those that didn’t get it. There’s only so much you can do with this grid-panel format!

WATCH WHERE YOU’RE GOING MIKE, DON’T YOU DARE RUN OVER AN ENDANGERED SPECIES.
I probably sound really obnoxious for saying this, but it kinda saddens to me to see Mike all.. watery-eyed. Like genuine pain.. aww. And people keep thinking he’s just pretending to give Lucy the win.. which definitely isn’t the case!!
It’s funny that Mike was genuinely thinking of letting her win again, you did that before! Admitting you did that is what got you in this mess in the first place! I think Lucy understands that you are far superior at running than her, she just can’t compete!

The Injured Mike arc begins…
I admittedly wanted to make his cast-wearing phase last a lot longer than it did.. but there’s an understandable “time skip” eventually. You’ll see how soon it heals.. then again, you don’t really expect that Mike’s leg is like.. HORRIFICALLY broken from just a fall. Probably just a sprained ankle or something. He’ll be fiiiiine.
I am clearly someone who has never gotten her foot broken before. I did wear something for a while when I stepped on glass and cut one of my toes, though!

17.title: Unfulfilled Fantasy
17.description: A letter arrives for Mike — a reminder of his childhood love.

author_commentary.veronica:
Oh dear what’s this? Something that’s gonna change the dynamic of the comic FOREVER?
Yashy is such a mongrel lmao

Lucy is taking this really well! I don’t see what Mike has to feel so nervous about.. surely he doesn’t need to feel guilty about what he’s doing at all!
Perhaps this is why Lucy kept rejecting Mike’s advances…
author_commentary.oliver: Let’s not disturb the lizard.

author_commentary.veronica:
Hey, it’s Lily! We haven’t seen her in a while.. Yashy and Blur have mostly been running the show, honestly. Did she really only just appear in the first chapter? I don’t even remember her appearance before this! She definitely becomes pretty useful for dramatic scenes so there’ll be much more of her coming up..
I particularly like how I made her so.. assertive and taunting in this chapter. Pretty much how she’s meant to be.
In the side-story I made as a teen, she was the bloody QUEEN of doing that. Lucy would go on a tangent and Lily would spout out something that would make Lucy quiver in realisation… Lily was very good at dramatic one-liners. These days she’s just someone who is good at talking to and hopefully giving advice.

Aww, this kid is doing his best!
.. first childhood friend, huh. HUH. Mike. MICHAEL..

YOUR FIRST CHILDHOOD FRIEND, MIKE, YOU SAY AS LUCY POPS IN, CLEARLY HAVING KNOWN YOU MUCH LONGER. MIKE. how dare you.
Then again, maybe you can’t blame him. Sandy is offering him a nice salmon and company in this trying time, meanwhile Lucy wants to pick fights and arm-wrestle. And she’s very pretty, that helps too.

Chomping-down-on-fish-Maishul delights me, he turned out so cute with his little cheeks sticking out ;\_\_; Baby boy.
Mike is a real sweetheart, implying with wide eyes that Sandy’s wealth makes her amazing. What a true peon. Meanwhile Sandy envies Mike’s actual skills!
To be fair, though, Mike only inititally got super attracted to you because of your skill at being pretty, Sandy!

THREE’S A CROWD, LUCYCHAN. GET OUTTA HERE.
poor girl, she just wants to arm-wrestle.. you can’t even give her that, Maishul?

SMOOTH, MIKE, REAL SMOOTH. Your nine-year-old self sure has a way with words.
Poor Lucy. Mike is definitely on cloud nine at the moment, but we all remember how clingy Lucy is to him.. and I guess this also helps to show the time of the scene.. since Yashy hatched on the first day of fourth grade (September 1).. so they’re nearing the end now.

This page was significantly reworked, back in the day! Before it was published to the site.
Originally it was meant to be about eight pages long, but Souppy really hated the ending and urged me to redo it. This current page takes elements from the original page (They both start out EXACTLY the same).. but completely new pages were added afterwards. The ones that were scrapped were actually used to make the next page! I hope this makes sense, the point is just that the tail-end of this chapter went through a lot of rewriting because I was still trying to figure out if Sandy was going to be a continual problem in this series, or if she’s just gonna be a bit of background info.
In other news Lily stop being such a blatant MikexLucy shipper!
Lily digging deep right now. Perhaps this is why Mike feels so guilty.. but also maybe Lily is just being a MikexLucy stan.
author_commentary.oliver: Just when you think Lily made her point…

author_commentary.veronica:
Very girlboss of you to manipulate Yashy into proving the point you’re trying to make, Lily..
She pulls the strings here.. perhaps Lily is the true villain.

Oh, right.. the prom is actually going on right now. You know the prom Daisy was advertising back in “Prom Preparation”? Yeah, that one. Guess all of Daisy’s attempts to get Mike to go with her failed, as well as everyone else who tried! Lucy wins again!!!!!!
I think there was a dance I was meant to go to once in middle school, I went there for a few minutes and then promptly left because I felt embarrassed. Turned out there was a ceremony celebrating me winning some award and they were gonna offer me a rose? I missed out!! And I was made to feel very bad about it the next day! Nobody told me!!! I was a lonely kid who couldn’t find any friends so I chose to go back home and play Super Mario RPG!
And honestly, I had a funner time playing that!
Anyway, enough of my embarrassing escapades. Lucy wouldn’t have felt embarrassed if she was in my shoes >8(
The decision is pretty easy to make.. and kind of right there in front of you, Mike.. why do you find it so difficult?

I love Chirpy’s innocence and obliviousness.. what’s amusing is that Yashy actually had that gullible personality in the comics I made predating BCB, whereas Chirpy was a bit more.. intelligent. Chirpy used to roll her eyes when Yashy would take things literally.
That personality trait seems to have completely slipped onto Chirpy, though, with good reason too! She’s the baby of the group! Can’t have two oblivious kids. Though Yashy’s oblivious in her own, chaotic way.
Anyway, what a nice way for things to end! Though a really important question has yet to be answered..
Just what is prom?

18.title: Farewell, Middle School
18.description: Middle school finally comes to an end. After saying goodbye to teachers, summer vacation begins.

author_commentary.veronica:
This is actually one of the scrapped pages from “Unfulfilled Fantasy”! When I originally finished the previous chapter, I wanted to end it in a lighthearted way so I switched the subject over to the day after the prom.. but Souppy thought it was a bit abrupt and should be redone.
I ultimately agreed, but I really really REALLY loved this page.. so it gave me the incentive to make it into its own separate chapter! In the end, I totally don’t regret the choice. I really love this sequence!
The expression David has in panel nine is meant to be similar to that onion-headed guy from Di Gi Charat, but I drew it from memory instead of picking up a reference!
I’m glad Flower Girl gets to shine in this, instead of staying an oblivious character in the backgrounds. Seems like they coulda gotten along! Perhaps David’s crush is not truly random..
author_commentary.oliver: Abarenbou!!!

author_commentary.veronica:
Second page that was scrapped and reused. This sequence honestly does have a completely different tone from Unfulfilled Fantasy. Souppy made the right call!
The beginning of the comic is actually a revival of a gag from pre-BCB comics, except then it was actually MIKE going around and fondling girls as he was passing through. The comic ended when he almost does that to Lucy and jolts back. Paulo didn’t exist at the time so Mike basically had to encapsulate any and all “male” traits. He would be a casanova while also being a huge wimp????
Luckily Paulo is here now to take all of his the worst traits lol
author_commentary.oliver: Oh, and I’m “Souppy”, by the way. Just a nickname thing! Along with “SuitCase”. (And “Taeshi”, for Vero.)

author_commentary.veronica:
Man, I’m gonna miss this cute dog teacher!! Because Mike and Lucy and the rest are switching to an entirely different school, you won’t get to see her again!! Which is quite depressing. She was always there in the old series.. but then again Mike and Lucy never ended up going to high school in those comics. So it’s no wonder I never had to say goodbye to her in the pre-BCB comics.
Stacy climbing ladders while still pretending to have her head in the clouds.. you should learn from Katie and become a full-fledged ditz!

I’m really going to miss the sex ed and gym teachers. Also notice how Yashy is gradually getting covered in chocolate. She had some on her face the panel before, but she is getting more and more now. CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT.
author_commentary.oliver: Somehow I think you’ll see this janitor again.

author_commentary.veronica:
This page is another one of the pages inspired by one of the canned pages from “Unfulfilled Fantasy”.. a lot of the sequences were exactly the same, even the end! There were some small changes.. I don’t know if I still have the original page to compare.
Man, didn’t you feel this way when school was over? I love that sort of.. utterly blissful feeling that this chapter is closed and you don’t have to worry about school for a few months. It’s really making me nostalgic for my school days.
Though it’s funny I’m getting nostalgic about school ENDING.

You know those times when you draw an expression and you feel you were DEAD-ON? Yeah, that’s the final panel for me.
At least Mike’s leg is healed! And speaking of chapters ending, this chapter has ended as well!
author_commentary.oliver: Time skip! Look at that healed leg.

author_commentary.veronica:
The characters will actually be aging throughout this series.. we’ll keep track of birthdays!
Mike’s birthday is the 10th of August. These little chapters help get you aware of how much time has passed in the story itself, so they’re pretty useful. Jon Arbuckle celebrates Garfield’s birthday, doesn’t he? It’s REALISTIC.
One thing to point out that’s amusing to me is that Red Lobster no longer sings this song.. at least the Red Lobster I used to work at. Isn’t that depressing? It’s such a nice and happy song, too! I’ll definitely miss it. They replaced it with the generic birthday song now. What a bummer!
Fun fact: Michael’s sister, Haley, has her birthday on August 9.. but she’s like a full year younger.. so she JUST turned thirteen.. but she’s too unimportant a character to get a celebratory comic. THAT’S JUST HOW IT’S ALWAYS BEEN.
author_commentary.oliver: Intermissions like this were originally in lurid Prismacolor-brand pencil, which was a bit of a sad thing to lose! But in the name of harmony, they’re rosy pink now.

19.title: Blurry Memories
19.description: Mike’s pet bird has always seemed a little mysterious.

author_commentary.veronica:
We’re nearing the end of summer vacation already..
When I used to post these updates to DeviantArt, I was actually updating as time passed in real life, so by the time I drew the eighth grade finale, we were already into the end of July if I remember correctly. And High School tends to end at the end of June at the LATEST. So I had very little time to squeeze summer vacation comics out if I wanted to keep up with the current time!
Luckily for me, I eventually decided that following current time was impossible, especially if I wanted to spend more time making the comics and planning events out properly.
And, I mean.. as of 2021, the characters are only now getting to the end of 2008. Time slowed to a crawl over in BCB land..
One amusing bit to add is that I actually did RESEARCH to find what books to have Mike reading. My friend was going to ninth grade at the time and he was made to read “Things Fall Apart”.. so that’s why I chose that as the book for Mike to read. I feel embarrassed because when I went to Honours English in my senior year, I was made to read “Things Fall Apart”.. I don’t know why I was issued it so late yet my friend got it so early in his school! Maybe my school was just stupid.
Or maybe I’m stupid, I only got to Honours English in senior year and that was due to an error!!!!! I still survived it…

Chirpy’s meant to be an infant around this time. Kids seem to learn languages very quickly! Chirpy was found near the end of 6th grade (April).. and this incident with Blur happened in the beginning of 7th grade.. around autumn so October or so. I really need to make a timeline of all the incidents happening so that this comic is made neat and lacking in paradoxes!
Lucy can’t deal being vulnerable around BOYS…

Yeah, Mike doesn’t live with Lucy.. he was just there to help her study. That has always been an amusing habit in the pre-BCB comics.. he was at Lucy’s place so often that it was as if Mike practically LIVED with Lucy.
And for a time, that was true.. in the pre-BCB comics, Mike’s house actually gets infested with termites so he’s forced to live with Lucy for.. about two years or so. I CLEARLY WASN’T THINKING, WHY WOULD HIS HOUSE BE INFESTED FOR TWO ENTIRE YEARS!!!
There were even some late-night stories that showed Mike sleeping in the living room.. this was also during the time they slept in boxes rather than beds a la Garfield. It’s so fun thinking back all these useless factoids. Clearly I just wanted to make it easy for Mike to hang out with Lucy all the time lol
Anyway, that’s all irrelevant right now, is it? LET’S PAY ATTENTION TO THIS CHAPTER

So the burning tree wasn’t meant to be a full-on joke, it actually has a point! CONSEQUENCES HAPPEN..
How nice of Lily to pull this bird out from possibly becoming roasted! Though he’s also in the rain so.. roasted wet bird? Gross..
Blur was the wounded bird in the rain who started it all.

Yeah, along with meeting Blur for the first time, Lily is introduced at this moment. She really has no specific past.. just being a traveler with no home. Quite a mystery.
Poor bird, getting kidnapped by cats!!! I guess he has nowhere else to go!! Is this what it’s like when a child is raised by wolves?

I like that Mike is showing here that he’s actually jealous of Lucy having so many pets, he wants one of his own! Is that so wrong?? I guess he couldn’t take Chirpy because Chirpy thinks Yashy is her mother..
Interesting how Lily chose to be with Lucy instead. She coulda gone to be with Mike! Maybe there is something wrong with you, Mike!
I guess the boys and girls are sticking together..

In the pre-BCB comics of olden times, Blur was unnamed for a VERY long time. He was just called “mysterious bird” by the others.. until Yashy just decided to GIVE him a name.
What’s silly is that Blur acted as if he DID know his name, he just didn’t wanna tell it to anyone. To tell you the truth, I named him Blur after this one artist at the time that I admired. Blur has gotten his own identity after all this time.. and now his name has a proper origin other than “I thought this name some artist had was cool so I’ll be using it for my character.”
Fly tag was a common game among all the flying pets in the pre-BCB comics. There was even a Togetic character participating!! I was an embarrassing kid, LEAVE ME ALONE.
There’s not much more to say about Blur, is there!!!! Moving on!

A continuation of the birthday comics.. September 1 was supposed to be the date of Yashy’s hatching! So I drew this up in advance and released it.. just in time.
Goodness, September 1 is a date that stuck in my mind for the longest time.. considering she hatched at the beginning of school.. so it was an easy date to remember! Although obviously school doesn’t really commonly start ON September 1. But it used to be the signal for school’s return, to me, long ago.
HAPPY FICTIONAL BIRTHDAY, YOU GREEN THING.

20.title: Hot Pursuit
20.description: Mike sees a familiar face on TV and embarks on a quest to find her in the city.

author_commentary.veronica:
Ooh, here’s a long one! I feel like this chapter started a trend where chapters got longer and longer and more and more serious. Though honestly, this one’s a fun ride!
The city (that is totally NOT New York I swear) was named after a colour! Or was it come sorta coffee.. something like that. Either way, it needed to not be named after an actual location.
Rickter is the original place Sandy went to.. this is pre-BCB canon LORE. And I guess because Rickter is a made-up name, not-New York had to be given a made-up name as well! See, Sandy changes everything.. including writing choices.
author_commentary.oliver: Living in IRL Maraschino has given us some perspective as to good-natured but annoying obscure parades that clog things up! Sometimes you just wanna cross fifth avenue but some jerks need are celebrating something important to them… oh, it’s terrible!

author_commentary.veronica:
Isn’t it funny how Mike has gone back to his original stance in terms of Sandy? Hence why Lily asks if he’s got amnesia. This shows how much of an effect Sandy has on Mike.. the sight of her inspires hopeless yearning, forcing him blindly try his best to find her again.
I guess we’ll see if it pays off this time!

Hi, Lucy! You showed up just in time for the UPCOMING ANGST. She was just heading over to his house.. oblivious of what’s to come..
I like how Mike is cranky about Lucy being so stubborn. Meanwhile I’m like “aww, she’s so cute!”, Paulo would be feeling the same, honestly.

You think Mike would get a break THAT easily? Maraschino is BIG. It’s not THAT convenient!!
Pretty sad that Lucy still doesn’t even know why he’s come up here.

Aww man, poor Lucy. She doesn’t seem to react to large quantities of water immediately, even though it can take a lot out of her. Pretty sad Mike doesn’t even consider that!!
Maybe he’s as oblivious as the reader because the reader still doesn’t know why water is such a big deal to Lucy!

I could not describe to you how long it TOOK to remember the word “lock” for the dialogue on panel six. You know when you have a word that’s so obvious and you have it at the tip of your tongue, yet you can’t REMEMBER it? Yeah, I finally asked people and got “lock.”
I have to say, maybe this guy is a genius if he’s able to create purses out of trash. He should be submitting these to art galleries!! You got something there!
Huge like Xbox float still makes me laugh even though it’s an old meme.. what can I say! It’s evergreen…
author_commentary.oliver: Like Xbox.

author_commentary.veronica:
This is the kind of reporting that gives a bad name to journalists everywhere, oh boy!
Also Mike looks adorable being so cute and short and little. Poor guy never gets a considerable growth spurt, while everyone else around him does!
The store that’s behind Mike where he spots Sandy is inspired by the famous old F.A.O. Schwarz toy store. It was so pretty and see-through.. I’d say to go check it out, but it’s been gone for many years :(

Much more influence from the real landmark here.. you could go to a second floor via an escalator and there were sections of stuff.. it isn’t a complete recreation, but yeah. You can see my inspiration very clearly!
You can ALSO see a tribute to Jackie Lesnick’s [“Girly”](http://jackie.horse/girly/) if you look hard enough!
Mike is quite an athletic guy. Look at all his tricks and stunts! Too fast to be asked to pay for damages!

Mike just CAN’T CATCH A BREAK.
I think I remember in the older design I tried to make the girl a bit.. ugly? But I thought that seemed a bit silly… she could just be a girl with black hair and a blue ribbon. Black hair isn’t rare!!! Especially with how Sandy wears it!

She was left to go and wait for Mike in the worst place possible, huh?
It haunts her dreams :(

Parents? In my comic?
Yeah, isn’t it weird that this comic is meant to be about teenagers yet we haven’t seen the parents play a part in their upbringing? I really haven’t had a need to focus on the parents.. but it’s not like the characters are living alone at home. WE ARE NOT IN AN ANIME
I have to say, this makes me wince so much, like Mike you coulda STAYED HOME. And you coulda STILL WON. Why did you need to be watching TV at the time Sandy appeared on the news! What a terrible, sad situation. How nice of Sandy to remember!!

Despite Yashy having blobs for hands, she can still flip someone off. You go, girl!
I’m glad that Lucy is being shown to not be fully okay with this. Perhaps this has influenced some of her past decisions.. it feels kinda crummy to feel like a second prize..

How nice of that wind to blow the scarf all the way to the tree right next to Mike’s place! Imagine if it got blown to, like, a garbage bin. Mike would have had to go shopping again!
And that’s the end of that chapter! Tune in for high school, coming right up!

21.title: Enter High School
21.description: As the new year begins, a new classmate arrives.

author_commentary.veronica:
When I first drew this chapter, I ran out of pages in my original notebook so I had to start a nice, clean, fresh, new one.
The new notebook is honestly a fitting beginning to a new chapter that highlights the beginning of high school! Art in my storytelling AND my media!!! Boy, I’m a genius!!
Anyway, I’m clearly more excited than Mike and Lucy, who are having the worst day of their lives. Didn’t the first day of school always feel stressful and awful??? I never looked forward to it!

SCHOOL…
Daisy is the only one genuinely excited about starting a new year. Something’s wrong with her!!!!!
Unlike these kids, my schedule often separated me from my friends. There were a few years in high school I had lunch where I didn’t know ANYONE. Miserable times! (Imagine being social enough to make new friends. Couldn’t be me!)
At least these guys get to enjoy time with each another.. though you gotta wonder how much better they’d be if they were separated sometimes.
author_commentary.oliver: Name drop! Roseville High it is.

author_commentary.veronica:
Hey, a new regular character! Tess is the creation of my friend Lily. You can check out her Tumblr [here](https://buttart.tumblr.com)!
Tess was given to me as a gift. While I at first didn’t know what to DO with her, Tess eventually became a vital character for multiple reasons.. so it’s wonderful to have her around. Thank you Tess for the chaos you created!
Tess gets to look cool and stylish, but to my detriment.. she’s such a challenge to draw ;\_\_; Why aren’t you just bald and simple like EVERYONE else! You’re putting the other cats to shame!
author_commentary.oliver: I do feel for Sue, sometimes.

author_commentary.veronica:
Paulo, you’re really overdoing it here.. I guess he spent the majority of summer vacation pining for Lucy and now he’s as obnoxious as ever. TOO MANY GIRLS RUIN HIS BRAIN.
I love the damn poodle too.

The Honours English teacher is actually meant to be a parody of the Honours English teacher I had for Senior year. She was an absolute sweetheart and a really amusing person as well, though she intimidated me. I always freaked out at her surprise essays and she used to take the scared reactions of the students in such an amusing way.. like “Ohh, be prepared! Use your brains!” etc etc.. she spoke like that except with a better vocabulary.
Sorry for making a joke of you, teacher.. essays were never really my thing..
The CP English teacher is also a parody of the teacher I had in junior year. She was just really young, really bubbly, really pretty. I adored her.. she actually got married in my senior year and people said she became a bit meaner afterwards.. which is unfortunate, but I’ll always love her.
She actually suggested me as Student of the Month in October and they ACCEPTED IT. Thank you, lovely teacher! I don’t believe the people who thought you were mean!!!
Daisy in this page will always remind me of this sophomore that was in pre-calculus in my senior year. I felt like such an idiot around her since she was the best at it and SO SO YOUNG. Goodness.

Lucy.. why aren’t you gravitating towards Mike like you usually do.. what’s going on..
They’re giggling at the “Hi! I’m Daisy!” bit at the end because that references Mario Kart Double Dash.. this joke was made a lot more in the older comics before they were edited so it feels a little out of place in retrospect :( BUT ALL YOU NEED TO KNOW IS THAT THESE KIDS ARE NERDS

22.title: A Difficult Choice
22.description: Plagued with mixed feelings and potential love interests, Mike struggles to make a decision.

author_commentary.veronica:
You thought Lucy let go of that Sandy incident easily? I don’t blame her for resenting Mike a little, it’s weird that Mike parades around as a single guy when it’s obvious he has his heart set on one faraway girl in particular.
Though honestly, before Sandy became relevant to the rest of the world, Mike was acting like his heart was already set on a girl who wasn’t so far away at all..
Either way, Lucy seems to be slowly closing off.

That sequence between Paulo and Lucy is the best ever. And isn’t it a bit of deja vu with the sequence of teachers? The Honors English, then the CP English.. then the English I teacher.. pretty much the exact same pace as they were introduced in the comic before!
Also, Yashy almost always comes to school with Lucy. She’s either hanging out in Lucy’s bookbag or being carried by her.. Yashy seems like she’s appearing out of nowhere, but she’s always around.. watching.. waiting..
Unless she wants to stay home and play games with Blur and Lily, of course.

The really funny thing about this chapter is that originally, Mike just plain ol’ decides he’s dating Sandy, without actually confirming it with her?? I guess he thinks it’s THAT obvious now..
I remember a fan pointing that out, and that actually resulted in the following sequence, isn’t that just silly? Back then I was just doing whatever I wanted to the point that I needed the audience to tell me when I wasn’t making sense! WELL NOT ANYMORE OF COURSE, I take this comic super seriously now!!!!!
.. I would hope!!!
Seriously enough in the sense that I’m not making up garbage as I go! Eventually around a certain point in Volume One I genuinely started planning ahead, and this chapter is an example of when I wasn’t doing that so much. Thank you, fan that told me it was weird Mike decided he was dating Sandy without talking to her about it! You changed history!
And with the redraw/rewrite, I make it very extra clear Mike is going to talk to Sandy after this.

A self-explanatory ending.. I feel bad how I made him attempt to hug Lucy because it’s obvious he still has feelings for her.
Rude boy.. this is why Paulo assaults you..

23.title: A New Leaf
23.description: With a refreshed mind and positive outlook, Mike’s strutting around with confidence.

author_commentary.veronica: Look at him, a changed man! A new beginning! A whole new Maishul! It’s all because of the scarf, of course. The scarf was the source of his depression and trauma.

He’s so happy, awww!
I do genuinely feel bad for Lucy. I feel like over time a lot of the characters started to fit into archetypes, and Lucy’s archetype slowly became “tsundere.” She wasn’t always this way! But her progression honestly makes sense.. Mike’s actions are making her crankier and crankier and more standoffish, for good reason honestly.
Imagine having a boy treat you like how Mike did in “Off to the Movies” and then find out he has a quasi-girlfriend! I wouldn’t be feeling too friendly, myself!

Souppy thought that David looked like a goomba in panel eleven of the original version hahaha
I liked that expression so much that I wanted to keep it in the redraw/rewrite, though lol, he still looks a little Goomba-ey.

I love that Daisy is mourning Mike as if he just freaken died. I guess there’s technically some mourning she needs to do, even though Mike was not really available before Sandy.. get in line, Daisy.
Anyway, that’s the end of that!

24.title: Wardrobe Malfunction
24.description: So why doesn’t Mike wear his blue scarf anymore?

author_commentary.veronica: Daisy is quite a squeamish girl, I don’t blame her. I’m incredibly squeamish as well! I can’t deal with seeing any liquids that come out of humans, makes me want to throw up :( Seeing a snotty person sneeze is the stuff of nightmares to me

LOOK AT THAT NOSEBLEED JUST LIKE IN ONE OF MY JAPANESE ANIMES oh god kill me
Paulo really is a cocktail of disgusting right now ufgdhgfkhgfhg
I would run away from him too.

I remember editing rescanning this page several times in the original run because there were some SERIOUS mistakes — Lucy’s punching hand kept switching sides because I was terribly forgetful.. she had the blood and snot on her left and it changed to her right.. so that had to be fixed.
Even in redrawing it now, it’s made me self-conscious and I’m now staring at Lucy’s arm with the hope I didn’t make that same mistake AGAIN.

Man, Sue, I used to do the same thing.. don’t feel too embarrassed.
It’s funny when you’re just mindlessly doing a repetitive task that is semi-dangerous, like don’t move the carton around with the straw!! It really might fall over!!
Anyway, let’s all hope that Mike doesn’t snap one day and kill everyone because I guess I wouldn’t be able to make this comic anymore!
author_commentary.oliver: Everyone here is so rude to Mike!

24.1.title: Daisy’s Birthday
24.1.description: A gift like this wasn’t exactly what Daisy was asking for.

author_commentary.veronica:
Daisy’s birthday is the 27th of September. Hooray for fictional birthdays!!
And hooray for copyrighted outfits! Daisy doesn’t want to get in trouble so she burned it, thankfully.

25.title: Humble Approach
25.description: Daisy loses heart as she realises she’s not going to get the boy she always wanted.

author_commentary.veronica: Aww, Daisy :( Feeling rejected without actually having faced actual rejection..

Welcome Abbey to the comic! Hello, Abbey!
Now DAISY gets to know what it’s like to reject people :) Maybe you can empathise with Mike now!!!
Abbey trying so hard to be a kind, gentle soul but he’s got.. that rage.. brewing.. don’t worry, Paulo brings that out of a lot of people.

The fun fact about Abbey is that “Abbey” was originally meant to be his “unofficial filler name” when I was creating him.
Abbey is an Abyssinian cat.. so I gave him the codename “Abby”.. and after a while of using it to describe him, that name really stuck.
So I gave him the name “Abbey” after “Abraham”.. Abby just makes me think too much of Abigail although it’s already a girly name.. I don’t know how an “e” makes a difference, BUT IT DOES TO ME DAMMIT.
Anyway, isn’t it funny that a codename for a character led to me calling his father Abraham, and led to me slowly developing a reason as to why Abbey doesn’t want to be referred to as Abraham. THE PIECES ALL FELL IN PLACE.

Fun fact.. Khao Manees are meant to be a Thai breed.. and I read that as a local custom, if you pat someone from Thailand on the head, it’s HIGHLY disrespectful. Since the head is meant to be the most sacred part of the body, the feet being the worst.. so I feel it’s amusing that Lucy, being a Thai cat, totally smacked Abbey for patting her on the head. I didn’t realize the coincidence until later! Seriously, Lucy hits anyone that touches her, but when I found that out, it amused me.
If I got that information wrong, feel free to correct me! And no, I wasn’t making a reference to Girly with the laser gun bit.. although after a while of finishing this comic, I realized this and thought “.. Whoa.. deja vu.. hope people don’t think I ripped it off!”

26.title: Left Behind
26.description: Tess asks why Lucy is so abrasive. Fortunately, Mike has enough experience to offer some answers.

author_commentary.veronica:
The beginning of this comic is actually inspired by a Pchat I had with Lily where Tess threatened Paulo if he wouldn’t lay off Lucy.. it inspired me to start this chapter with them bickering similar to the Pchat. Pchats with Lily are always awesome since it gives me an opportunity to develop their personalities, especially with Tess, who I needed to get a feel of.
Tess gave Mike a scarf to borrow, by the way! It didn’t just appear out of nowhere.. he was just trembling cold so she gave him a scarf! For how long will he wear it? We’ll see..

I used to spell “Kindergarten” as “Kindergarden” and in the original version of this chapter, that’s the way I wrote it, but it’s been many years since then and since then there’s been many MANY eyes looking over this comic and correcting me on my mistakes! I just think it’s funny to know.. at least it’s been edited.
Dang, Lucy, your ribbon is huge! You almost made me think you’re a butterfly!

It’s unfortunate how much of an outcast she became. She just went to the wrong people to play.. I’m sure not all kids are like that, but she just interacted with some really rude kids and that affected her in a bad way.

Lucy is prone to kindness, though! It wasn’t like she was a bitter angry girl ALL THE TIME.. she definitely can smile and laugh. She just doesn’t like showing that side so easily, just to people she can trust.

author_commentary.oliver: Not the best experiences with boys, huh.

author_commentary.veronica:
Mike’s new scarf! Hooray! Perhaps with the blue scarf making him depressed, the orange and yellow scarf can make him.. happy? Maybe?
Let’s hope!

27.title: Flirting with Disaster
27.description: A truth or dare question reveals that there’s more to Lucy and Paulo’s friendship than meets the eye.

author_commentary.veronica:
Tess and Abbey are clearly MikexLucy fans, too. So many characters ship MikexLucy! I think the only person who doesn’t actively ship them is Daisy and Paulo.. for, well, understandable reasons each.
I wonder if Lucy whispered the answer knowing only Mike would be able to pick it up. Did she want to rub it in??
(No, she didn’t. Mike just has ridiculous hearing. I think Lucy would have rathered nobody heard)
Aww, baby Paulo!! What a charming sweet little lad! Funny how Daisy shows off her peppy kindness and even in the past she gets ignored over Lucy.. almost enough to give you a complex about Lucy, huh?

Paulo arrived as a new fifth grade student in the beginning of winter so that’s why he and Daisy are wearing little coats.. it’s not exactly cold as hell, though. If that were the case, Mike should also be wearing a coat, but he isn’t!
He’s sensitive to cold, yet he’s doing his best, I guess.. Paulo and Daisy just wanna look pretty.
Oh, and remember Daisy mentioning she had a crush on Mike since fifth grade? Well, you can kind of see that developing!

Paulo’s side of the story! This part of the chapter was completely rewritten for the Omnibus because, as I’ve said in past commentary, I originally wanted Paulo to be linked to the bad guys from Confrontation as part of some convoluted attempt to tie storylines together. In retrospect, however, I found this plotline embarrassing and cringy, and didn’t actually develop it any further from here.
IT’S JUST TOO DAMN CONVENIENT. And so I’ve altered it to be something more realistic, rather than Paulo getting groomed by older kids into being a horndog :l ugh
.. Though given some way-into-the-future storylines, Paulo is showing a side of himself he doesn’t really reflect on for many many years..

I like that he trained himself to be confident around Lucy, only to be PAINFULLY REJECTED. Maybe some girls like a confident super forward guy, but not everyone does!!! You damn fool!!
He honestly couldn’t have tried it on a worse girl.

Paulo is gonna be glowing for months after this, At least the group gets to see a more vulnerable side of him! Even though he’s back to his old ways.
Anyway, no need to get so jealous, Mike! You got a girlfriend a phone call away! Did you forget about her?
author_commentary.oliver: Another standout line for me: Daisy’s “Surprisingly.”

27.1.title: Lucy’s Birthday
27.1.description: It’s difficult to prepare a surprise party for Lucy. Will it actually work this year?

author_commentary.veronica:
Hey, our female protagonist hasn’t had a birthday yet! We should be celebrating that sometime soon, right? Well, today is Lucy’s lucky day!
It’s too bad she’s too much of a wet blanket to just let Mike have one day where he can surprise her :( For someone who is half-deaf she sure is perceptive!

Lucy got a very wonderful and thoughtful birthday present this year — the chance to break Paulo’s hand. How very considerate of him to offer it!
It’s kinda sweet to think that despite Paulo’s intentions, he really did round all these people up to create a surprise party for Lucy. What on earth were YOU doing, Mike!

If Lucy can tease Mike about Sandy, surely Mike can tease Lucy about Paulo! Even though she and Paulo aren’t dating..
Actually.. a bit salty there, aren’t you Maishul?!?!??!!?
Regardless, happy birthday Lucy!!!

28.title: Feline Festivities
28.description: Christmas is around the corner, and everyone is invited to Tess’ party. Tension and punch ensue.

author_commentary.veronica:
This was actually the first comic posted to the very earliest version of the BCB website. All the other chapters before this were posted exclusively to DeviantArt.
.. but of course that doesn’t matter now this chapter was entirely redrawn and exists on the proper website that started in 2009!!!! Dang!
Mike, perhaps it’s unusual for your girlfriend to be floating.. I think she needs to get something checked.

MIKE WHAT ARE YOU DOING
We all know what Mike’s thinking.. a very serious hand-holding session.
I like how Lucy holds Tess’ letter like a piece of trash.
author_commentary.oliver: What a pure child!

author_commentary.veronica: Last panel seems to continually crack me up whenever I read it, Lucy is so very rude! You don’t have to be a magical being to be positive, Lucy!

Aww, Mike’s little beanie is so cute on him ;\_\_; It makes his ears droop!!!! Bawwww!!
Been a while since we’ve seen Lily lecture an emotional cat!

Tess is well-endowed in the cash department as you can see. The design of the house was actually made for me by Tess’ creator, Lily herself! I was wondering how Lily wanted Tess’ house to look.. so she scribbled up a plan for it in paint.
Thank you so much, Lily! It definitely helped me a million since I suck at designing buildings.. please, anything but that..
Just thinking about Blur nesting on Mike’s head under the beanie, getting himself nice and warm..

I really like how Paulo looks in the final panel.. almost like he’s just about to trip, but trying his best to regain his balance.
A pretty ingenious, idea, honestly! Hangs off his hat perfectly!

Mike is so CUUUTE. I’m surprised I haven’t made him wear his coat during the course of winter considering he’s painfully sensitive to the cold. He’s not a Lucy.
I admit I kinda got this way in senior year.. when prom was happening, I kind of hoped that Souppy would show up, even though that was impossible! How could he coordinate a secret surprise for me like that without knowing the venue, flying in on time, and traveling all the way to see me? Mike is being very silly to just assume Sandy is going to come visit him, but I feel you man. I totally get getting carried away with a daydream.
Unlike Mike, though, I knew it was a silly daydream, and I didn’t let it get to me. Just woulda been nice! Oh well!! I’ll see Souppy another day!

I like that Tess chastised Paulo for bothering Lucy and getting in her personal space, but now Tess is getting all up in Lucy’s business. I guess boundaries don’t count for everyone, rich girl!!!!!
Mike, you gotta let it go man

Tess isn’t free from getting hit, contrary to popular belief! Get into Lucy’s bubble like Paulo, get hit like Paulo I suppose.
Birds of a feather~!
I kind of liked how the end of this page panned out.. you saw the ordeal with Tess getting hit and Abbey running to her rescue.. but it was in the perspective of Chirpy, who was interested in something else, not them. A good flow, if you ask me!
David is so rude, using truth or dare as a way to force Lucy to do things because she’s competitive.

Mike, she’s like, two years old. Maybe you shouldn’t be infodumping all over a baby..
