Poor Chirpy, though :( She really feels like she’s missing out on something, even though Yashy is right there.
.. To be fair, Yashy is probably not the best mother material right now, being a baby herself.
Good thing Lucy didn’t turn around to immediately punch the assailant because Chirpy woulda been in a REAL world of hurt then! Instead she just took a peaceful tumble to the ground :'(

Abbey is such a wet blanket haha, but honestly maybe that kind of person is needed considering what Paulo and David get themselves into. David didn’t mean any actual harm, though! Just physical harm! To your throat! And organs!
.. honestly maybe Abbey is not a wet blanket after all. Maybe he is a normal person.
Paulo thinks Katie is super attractive, but never considers her, I guess because she never considers Paulo and only really likes Mike because everyone else does!

Good thing Chirpy isn’t dead or a completely different conversation would be happening right now..
It’s so sad that Lucy is beating herself up over this like you’re barely a teenager man, you’re putting WAY too much pressure on yourself!

Paulo should swim more to develop holding his breath for longer periods of time!!!!!
Tess wanted to see if she could kill a man with only her lips.

Aww Paulo is so happy, he looks very sweet in panel two.
There was a baby I used to babysit when I was in college and I basically had to put her to bed while her parents were at work. Oftentimes, I played this particular song to her as she dozed off, it was a song that got stuck in my head constantly!! It was the same set of spanish songs, and I guess that inspired me to get Lucy to sing the same song to lull her own pets to sleep!
MERRY CHRISTMAS, EVERYONE.

29.title: Midterm Time
29.description: Exam time is coming, and Tess turns to Daisy for help despite the inherent embarrassment of being tutored by a freshman.

author_commentary.veronica:
Even though I was beginning to really plan out the entire story around this time, there were still chapters made purely in response to reader feedback. One reader remarked that they thought Tess was too perfect — they got particularly annoyed by Tess tipping the Christmas carollers a ton of money in the previous chapter. Looks, money, a cute and sassy personality, Tess just seems to have it all. And it really annoyed this person! Understandably, honestly!
So I decided to make Tess not very impressive at school, and that idea snowballed into this chapter! Where Daisy, who Tess was initially getting pretty annoyed by, gets to help her!
It also reveals a little snarky side to Daisy, where she’s a little too blunt, but it’s for your own good, she swears!!!

Lucy keeps throwing things at Tess and Daisy, just in case the page doesn’t show that clearly enough! I guess if Tess is gonna be too busy getting humiliated by Daisy, Lucy gets to at least rummage through Tess’ stuff.
It’s SO weird seeing Daisy hit Lucy, YOU GOT IT IN YOU GIRL!!!! I’m so proud!
author_commentary.oliver: There’s something very cute about Mike’s confusion while Lucy was totally on the ball.

author_commentary.veronica:
Daisy has favourites as a tutor, too!
I like that this chapter displays Daisy’s habit of being innocently blunt. She doesn’t really know she’s being offensive.. Daisy doesn’t mean it. She’s just being honest! What’s so offensive about honesty?
She’s a huge suck-up to people like Mike, but to everyone else Daisy is a genius who can see things in a different perspective. It’s sometimes hard to remember she’s meant to be really smart because most of the time she’s ogling and going gaga over Mike.

Hey, the math teacher returns! He got a short amount of spotlight in Enter High School, so here is more of him! He wants all his students to succeed, isn’t he so noble?
In the earlier version of this page, the math teacher demands David go to the principal’s office in the final panel because he’s so angry, and in retrospect that’s so corny! Why make David go to the principal’s office for being an idiot? Instead I just like the idea of Mike holding the teacher back from certain child-killing, but he’s impotent at the end of the day. He can’t do a thing about this! David won the war!

Daisy shows off a bit of her half Selkirk Rex gene.. since she got insanely curly near the end. When under stress, that tends to happen to her.. so it’s no wonder Daisy likes staying upbeat and perky!
Rain and stress — Daisy’s worst enemies. This kinda thing does appear again in the future!
author_commentary.oliver: This page certainly brings back memories. Practice tests being far more savage than the real ones, yet you never dare assume they’ll go easy on you.. I remember that sense of exam-day satisfaction Tess has here.

29.1.title: Tread Carefully
29.1.description: Paulo isn’t pleased about having to go to school, but Daisy can think of an entertaining distraction.

author_commentary.veronica:
This comic was inspired by Azumanga Daioh and my own experiences, too! I always used to make wishes or give myself goals whenever I would walk over zebra crossings. It was only when I saw the Azumanga Daioh comic that I thought “Wow, I’m not the only one!”
I thought Daisy would be the type to encourage that kind of play, and Paulo is absolutely eager to impress.

30.title: Troubled Waters
30.description: This term, Phys. Ed is all about swimming. But why isn’t Lucy involved?

author_commentary.veronica:
Oh man, it’s about time!
So what IS up with Lucy’s fear of water?
All those questions finally answered in THIS chapter!
This chapter went through multiple rewrites.. I drew an older version of this story, but never found the time to post it on DeviantArt.. and so much time passed that I forgot about it to the point that the comic became outdated and if I wanted to post it, I would have had to draw it all over again.
Anyway, not only did it get rewritten considerably then, but it got rewritten AGAIN during the Omnibus NOW! Here is the best version of this flashback!
I really love the conclusion Tess jumps to, sometimes I forget I wrote that and when rereading it, it takes me by surprise. I mean, not a ridiculous theory!

See the two people hugging? They’re meant to be based on two oooolllddd characters I had back in the old series — Bill and Briana.
Their designs are altered massively, but yeah.. they used to be the class bullies, but they were madly in love with eachother.. so if Briana was attacked, Bill would blindly defend her. It was cute.. shame they never made it far.
I guess far enough to be hugging on this page and to trigger some flashbacks!
I’m glad Mr. Noodles is being so accommodating.

gotta get back.. back to the past..
I like that Mike climbed that tree to actively avoid Lucy. Can’t get rid of her that easily though!
It’s nice to see that even though Paulo was a much more timid kid back in the day, is confidence boost was not out of nowhere. Paulo always had potential to be outgoing and extroverted!
Lucy needs to fight her simmering crush on Paulo to keep an eye on Mike and his wellbeing!
Aww, David, you extended the chapter length! How kind of you! I was worried it was gonna end right there!

In the earlier version of this page, Mike ended up nearly falling down a waterfall, which is honestly so clichéd! And incredibly unrealistic! Why would a random-ass waterfall exist in a public park? Shouldn’t it be closed off? Do these kids live in the woods? The freaken WILDERNESS or something?
Mike getting pulled by dangerous streams is bad enough, but I wanted to tone down the scene while also maintaining it as scary and serious, so instead I rewrote it to Mike getting bludgeoned by rocks. It makes a lot more sense! Mike was able to grab a rock earlier so it’s not like they came out of nowhere!
You can notice Lucy’s fear flare up for a second there.. obviously, it wasn’t as extreme in the past.. at this time, it was just typical fear of water because she can’t swim. A natural and understandable concern!

Sometimes, you just need to take a dive to save someone you care about…
yes that was a pun DO YOU WANNA FIGHT ABOUT IT
You can do it, Lucy! I’m sure it’s not that deep!

Here Paulo comes to save the day!
I was originally gonna make Lucy save Mike all by herself but I felt that was a bit too unrealistic? You don’t really just sprout swimming abilities out of nowhere. Also, despite this being a traumatic event, Lucy saving Mike means that Lucy shouldn’t really be as fearful, since she was capable of rescuing her friend! That should surely be a confidence boost!
So instead Lucy and Mike sank like rocks only for Paulo to jump in and rescue them both. Paulo is meant to be almost as athletically capable as Mike so it makes sense! But it really does stress to Lucy that her concern about swimming was perfectly valid. It’s too bad that engulfs her overtime.

Souppy said it woulda been amusing if Mike coughed up all the water onto Lucy.. and I agree, that woulda been great. Oh well, THIS IS SERIOUS BUSINESS NO TIME FOR COMEDY.
Poor Paulo, I’m sure if you let Mike die you STILL wouldn’t have won Lucy’s heart.. she might have held that against you for the rest of your life, actually.

Lucy just can’t handle her feelings right now :( Even though Mike is the one who almost freaken died lol
.. Lucy also almost died as well, to be fair. Maybe it’s okay she’s so upset.

Paulo looks so much more mature than his old self.. I feel a bit proud of that.. he looks younger in flashbacks which is hard to do with other characters, especially other boys. Mike essentially looks the same..
You know, you don’t have to make yourself completely responsible for someone else’s life at such a young age, Mike..

Aww, look at how Paulo almost cradles Lucy as he hugs her, swinging her from side to side a little bit! It’s very cute, I admit I always “feel” that hug when I see that panel, since he’s really grabbing onto her and swinging about.
Anyway, goodness, Mike. You can’t even give Paulo THAT. That being the ability to gloat about swimming.. so very competitive!
And now you all know! And I’m sure past chapters will make a ton more sense now!
author_commentary.oliver: Boys will be boys.

31.title: Carry On
31.description: Swimming brings Daisy’s lack of self-confidence to the fore, while Mike laments Lucy’s strange phobia.

author_commentary.veronica:
Katie is trying her best. I’m sure she can find some clever lie to get herself out of the pool eventually.. just gotta think about it.
Who is this boy.. what is his deal.. getting a little close there.
Anyway, you thought you were done with flashbacks? SWEET. SUMMER. CHILD.

Some people missed the old Phys. Ed. teacher.. well, here he is again since they’re back in Middle School for this flashback! Hooray!
Lucy is certainly not celebrating this, it’s not like this pool is a running stream! You won’t be pulled away!

You can see Lucy’s train of thought in this.. just bashing herself endlessly about various worries and concerns.. building up until it finally explodes into a frenzy.. everything is completely unstable.
It’s sad because Mike doesn’t really understand what’s happening to her, and you can’t really blame him because he was unconscious for a lot of the time! He didn’t think what happened was that big of a deal, but it really took a toll on Lucy.

It’s a wonder she hasn’t fainted and fallen into the water before! Not a very good defence mechanism there, Lucy!
Anyway, can’t have a kid faint in the pool and drown, I’m sure that wouldn’t do a lot of good for the school’s reputation!

Katie, what are you even doing here.. it’s not like you didn’t lie your way into getting excused already!
Fun fact about Katie using her period as an excuse in the previous page — I actually DID have my period when we had to go swimming in High School so I was excused, but I used to have extremely long periods. They would last over a week. So unfortunately for me, my teacher told me to get into the pool a week after I was excused.. and I was still bleeding!!
The teacher didn’t believe me, though, and what was I supposed to do, show her some bloody tissues? Gross! Fortunately I wasn’t bleeding THAT much, so I was able to swim around without anyone noticing. I remember rushing back in a panic afterwards, in fear people would.. see..
Anyway, that was embarrassing!
Hmm, what are doing there.. what is your deal, Final Fantasy Cat..
author_commentary.oliver: Self-reliance! That’s the way to do it, Lucy.

32.title: Follow Me
32.description: Daisy is upset that her male friends only seem to care about “hot” girls like Tess. She seeks comfort from a stranger.

author_commentary.veronica:
Follow me, set me free, trust me and we will escape from the city..
Yashy likes to appear when she pleases.. she doesn’t follow Lucy to school half as much as she used to. It probably has to do with her getting older.. or maybe Blur/Lily/Chirpy are more fun to hang around with, but I guess this is one of those days where she hangs out with Lucy and the others.
Speaking of appearing characters, this is the first time we see Alec McCain! He was created by T. Ashley Jenkins, creator of [Petal Crash](https://www.petalcrash.com)! Play this puzzle game, it is very good!!
McCain was a bit of a surprise.. but I liked him very much and really wanted to include him in the comic.. don’t expect him to appear too regularly, though.
I think his.. distance is what makes him.. McCain.. he’s very good in small doses, just the way he likes it. I hope I use him well enough on those uncommon times he DOES appear! I guess he’s like David except opposite in personality.
Woof.

When Yashy heard about a possible girlfriend several chapters ago, it was very common for there to be rumours about Mike. He did have a lot of people pining for him, after all!! So he’d get a love letter from a random crush and people would whisper about him possibly accepting that crush’s love..
Long story short, Lucy dismissed the idea of Mike having a girlfriend, and Yashy was none the wiser. But now Lucy realises that Yashy would take Mike having a girlfriend that is NOT Lucy very VERY badly, so better keep quiet, Mike!
.. though that’s honestly terribly cruel. Mike hasn’t been in an official relationship with Sandy that long and he already has to invalidate it because Yashy is too strong of a MikexLucy shipper???

Hey, it’s this guy again, and he comes with FANS.
Okay, not fans. Just Tess not trusting him because.. she has her reasons, and Abbey not trusting him because he wants to GET WITH DAISY GRRRRRRR.
Daisy keeps feeling unwanted but in this page alone I can count at least two guys who like her! I guess if it’s not Mike it might as well be nobody!

I really love that Daisy predicted EXACTLY what one of her friends would say, I guess it’s a bit of a sad sign that the friend is Paulo! But.. I mean, Abbey cares ;\_\_; Maybe you should care about Abbey more, Daisy.
In the earlier version of this page, Daisy was really mopey and sad, but I really wanted to show off her bitter side in the remake. Daisy is kind of a brat! She’s jealous! Instead of victimising herself tragically, she’s instead very angry and petty! Feels like a much more realistic angle given Daisy’s confidence issues, and while it might turn some people off her, it absolutely endears her to me. Because I’ve totally been there! Many people have!

God it sucked when teachers made you change in front of everyone else and not use the bathroom, how annoying was that? No consideration for people’s feelings!
You’re too slow, Abbey..
I do like that Paulo is getting a lot more protective of Tess, in not just a “friends look out for each other” way, I think he’s beginning to feel things.

CHOOSE THE HERO OR DARK SIDE?! YOU DECIDE!!
Lucy comes up to Daisy and shows her vulnerable side, and Daisy blows it off due to her jealousy! Will she ever learn!
author_commentary.oliver: I think you’ve got to take Lucy’s words with a grain of salt, here. Nothing’s quite so simple.

author_commentary.veronica:
NO TESS THE SADNESS GOT YOU TOO
I never expected these two girls to come back other than to be linked to Tess’ questionable past, but I am so so glad they did. Thank you Tess, for inspiring me to make Jessica and Rachel!!!
author_commentary.oliver: Poor annoyingly persistent Paulo.

33.title: Onwards to Adventure
33.description: It’s David’s 14th birthday, and the sky’s the limit!

author_commentary.veronica:
“Kikiri kikiii” is actually meant to be the spanish version of when a rooster does the “cockle-doodle-doo”.. but I always thought the Spanish version was better hence why I used it.
Wow, a birthday chapter that is.. full length? What an honour! David might as well be the main character of BCB, huh? Even Lucy only got a measly three pages!
author_commentary.oliver: This page is a memorable one to me for a secret reason — it’s the sample page Veronica and I worked on when testing out production methods for the remaking of these chapters. It had a lot of background variety, it had captions, it had digital and hand-drawn text… it was perfect! So I salute you, page 1 of Onwards to Adventure. You walked so the Omnibus could run.

author_commentary.veronica:
A CHALLENGER APPEARS
Paulo you are so RUDE!!!

Eye..brows..
I don’t fully remember if I had the kid’s camera fall off because I didn’t feel like drawing it anymore, or because the camera would allow people to figure out his identity, which will be useful for the future!
But at least the kid doesn’t have to take creepshots of the flower girl now. That would go too far, David >8( This isn’t Pokemon Snap!

David imagines all his friends in specific roles for the fanfics in his head. What would he think.. of you..
Man, Augustus used to look so cool. He really softened over time, in design and in personality.

Aww, there she is! So glorious nobody but David is allowed to praise her, it seems.
I really like how I maintained a lot of the old expressions in this redrawn version, there is a lot of bubbly energy!

I remember getting super fed up by the end of this page and started drawing incredibly sloppily, probably taking less than a minute to draw the last three panes. I got a chance at redemption in the redraw, even though the scenes are very simplistic to begin with.
It doesn’t look sloppily out of place anymore, at least!
And that’s the end of that chapter! Happy birthday, David! I’m glad you weren’t thrown into juvenile prison for your crimes against humanity!

34.title: Bonding
34.description: Daisy spends more time with her newfound friend, and he reveals there’s more to Tess than meets the eye.

author_commentary.veronica:
Welcome to yet another installment of BCB! i herd you like drama so here’s some drama with your drama
Abbey has been shown to have a bit of a short fuse in previous chapters, but now it’s getting a little scary..
Isn’t it sweet that Abbey wants Paulo to care more about Daisy rather than selfishly wanting her all to himself? He cares about Daisy’s happiness!

Wow, he sure doesn’t like Tess! You couldn’t just let it go when you coulda been bonding with your girl!
I’m glad he’s at least focusing on Tess as opposed to getting jealous about Daisy’s forever crush on Mike.

I remember in the earlier version of this dialogue, Daisy got flustered at the very idea of Tess having a boyfriend. You’re not a pure little princess, Daisy! It’s not too embarrassing or shocking to have a boyfriend!
A lot of old dialogue was definitely written from the eyes of a total conservative.
.. Conservative in the ways of romance, not politics I mean :l blurghh.
author_commentary.oliver: I think you’d generally assume older girls would have had a boyfriend, at these ages. Tess certainly had an eventful life!

author_commentary.veronica: It’s genuinely sweet to see Daisy hear about all this background information about Tess, and still take her side! Being empathetic, hoping for Tess to recover. Daisy is jealous of Tess, of course, but Tess is her friend and Daisy cares about her! Daisy can totally see Tess striving to be better and supporting her in her journey. What a pal!
Interesting that Daisy was genuinely considering reciprocating his advances, but nope, too thirsty for Mike. Would feel kinda sad to be pining for someone else while being in a relationship.

35.title: Under Pressure
35.description: Abbey reaches boiling point, Daisy flirts for attention, and Tess is haunted by her past.

author_commentary.veronica:
I’m glad David had such a memorable birthday that he’s still talking about it!
I love how springy Mike and Lucy are being when it comes to keeping Sandy’s existence away from Yashy. Even though this chapter is kinda serious, I like that there’s a lot of bounciness in expressions and reactions.

When I drew the earlier version of this page I was originally pretty frustrated.. I left it unfinished for a few days before I finally picked it up and continued.
I guess there’s technically a lot of floating around and talking, maybe that’s why I was annoyed? I guess it was also because I wanted to make the dialogue natural and good.. which was only fully corrected in the redraw/rewrite! I definitely like it much better these days, and I like the three weird girls. That was probably why I was fatigued in the first place. Because of their pattern of speech.
The three weird girls (taken from the pre-BCB comics I used to draw) have always been this way: the one to the left always speaks in questions, the one in the middle speaks in exclamations, and the one on the right speaks sort of flirtatious way or ends her sentences with an ellipsis. VERY SILLY MEME, BUT I LIKED IT. That’s probably why I had trouble with this page, initially! I had to follow specific rules, but now I have Souppy as an editor! And I’ve become a better writer to boot!

David, Paulo, and Mike are all-stars in their sports class.. and Paulo is feeling pretty awful that Mike and David surpass him with ease :( Even though he’s in the top three, he can’t quite measure up.
I am making a reference to Sonic and the Secret Rings in panel thirteen if you caught it. If not.. umm.. it was quite obscure a joke. Anyway, Daisy needs to pay more attention to where she’s going.

OH GEEZ IT LOOKS LIKE MIKE IS MISSING HIS TRUNKS IN PANEL FOUR HAHAHAHA, HE’S WEARING THEM I SWEAR!!!! They must, uhh, be hanging a bit too low, LOOK HE’S SAVING A LIFE RIGHT NOW OKAY????? He just needs to readjust himself afterwards!
Goodness, even in the redraw I completely overlooked that.. was I drawing too loyally to the original..
author_commentary.oliver:
It’s the sort of error that comes up when there’s tens of thousands of character drawings across many tens of hundreds of panels. We spent SO MUCH TIME rereading and fixing things like that, but eventually you gotta draw a line!
And that line is drawn at… not drawing a line on Mike’s waist here.

author_commentary.veronica:
Paulo, just quit while you’re ahead!
Then again, once you’ve done 500 sit-ups, you’re gonna be ripped as SHIT. Lucy will love you for sure!
author_commentary.oliver: That teacher reads comics like these.

author_commentary.veronica:
Daisy getting so embarrassed by Abbey’s words.. maybe there’s a reason you’re feeling this way..
She’s so bratty, get some better taste Abbey!

Paulo in panel twelve fills me with much delight.. I just love his cheerful and flirtatious expression.. especially with his follow up. Can’t be suave for too long!
Man he fell for her FAST. Their dynamic is certainly different from Paulo and Lucy where he can only tease her for so long before he gets smacked away. Tess flirts back!

WHAT THE HELL DUDE WHERE’S YOUR HALL PASS NO RUNNING IN THE HALLS
Jessica is not a snitch..
I kind of love how I made Abbey’s eyes so.. shrimpy when he’s furious, but they transform back to those soft big eyes at the end.

Who were you trying to find, Abbey..
Were you perhaps trying.. to find a therapist? Because it looks like you need one!
Anyway, I’m glad Tess is going to exercise some of her communication skills! Wow, she and Paulo are really going a long way!

36.title: Crash and Burn
36.description: Struggling to hide naughty content from her pets, Lucy finds herself at war with her computer.

author_commentary.veronica:
This comic is actually meant to be a remade version of a comic I drew back before BCB was a thing.
Lucy is very ONLINE.
Coo Coo Charms is an old brand I’ve been using in comics forever.. That and the soda brand “Blasto”.. which hasn’t been shown in this series yet, but it will appear eventually!
author_commentary.oliver: iChat nostalgia. Or AIM nostalgia, pick your flavour!

author_commentary.veronica: It’s nice to see that Lucy isn’t always as stoic as she’s been trying to be lately. She can still be an anxious, emotional mess. Just like any ol’ teenager!

Hey, we get to see Lucy’s mother again! Her first appearance was in an ooolllddd flashback way back in chapter two..
She still retains her pearl necklace, cramping Daisy’s style!
It just hit me now that Lucy’s mother has ONLY appeared in flashbacks! She’s not dead, I swear! She’s just.. doing housewifey things somewhere else!

Lucy being a very efficient covercat.
I really like the idea that Yashy talks to Mike in the final panel bringing up ZERO context, absolutely NO information. She’s so lost in thought that she asks him that question out of nowhere. That always really amused me. Poor Mike, once he knows context he’d probably grab Yashy and fling her across a stadium.

36.1.title: Out of the Frame
36.1.description: Upset by her apparent marginalization, Sue protests with a group of neglected classmates.

author_commentary.veronica:
Hey, new (and old!) readers, welcome to a completely revamped version of “Out of the Frame”!
This was a chapter that needed to be redrawn/rewritten pretty substantially!
Originally it highlighted a ton of fancharacters from the DeviantArt days that really shouldn’t be here anymore. And now they’re not, but this comic still is! It took a lot of work, but I was pretty determined to keep it,
I thought it was fun, there’s a lot of cute jokes, it depicts some nice development with Sue and McCain, and I thought some of the parts could still be recovered. It’s not like Sue didn’t stop feeling inferior, and I like the idea of Sue doing something petty like this! I felt it woulda been a disservice for Sue to have this one Sue-specific chapter be canned, so I wanted to save it.
Ultimately, I realised I created a lot of official minor characters that could fill the roles that needed to be replaced in this comic, and this is the result!
I honestly really like this change because I feel the original Out of the Frame was a little more mean-spirited? Which I didn’t want to maintain.
Besides, Katie would absolutely be jealous and eager to join a group if it meant getting more popularity! She fits into the role very well, and so the chapter wrote itself!
Also really happy to have another opportunity to utilise the three girls.

I like that Stacy is genuinely annoyed by McCain. I think originally he was being told to shut up because that’s what you do to him, but I don’t think the running gag has been properly established by now? So instead Stacy is just being upfront with her annoyance. Genuinely wants him to shut up!
Man, Katie, why didn’t you just stay chaotic! Why did you have to become an actual cruel mean girl to Daisy :( You had so much potential!
It’s funny how people genuinely forget McCain is McCain’s last name, I think Sue remains the only person who refers to him by his first name. Very romantic.. like one of my Japanese animes..

god i really love how I ended this, BECAUSE IT’S SO TRUE. WHAT ARE YOU ENVYING, SUE. Have you been paying attention AT ALL?????
Well, now you’re part of it and you’re stuck with it FOREVER…

37.title: A Different Side
37.description: Another pep rally gives Daisy her chance to shine. But past grudges find the worst times to bubble up to the surface…

author_commentary.veronica:
Nobody cares about your drama, Paulo! Right now we only care about VERY LOUD SOUNDS!!!!
Paulo really is getting super protective of Tess, he is so sweet :(
author_commentary.oliver: Oh David.

author_commentary.veronica:
Swimming class has come to a close now.. so Lucy gets to finally return from her little “cage” to torment Mike again. A wonderful, happy reunion!
Lucy’s peppiness is kinda cute, though, like a return to her very old, elementary school form, even if it might not be a form Mike enjoys very much.
Mike gets too much sympathy pain!

PauloxTess 4eva lollll ^\_\_\_^;;
I like that the gym teacher is essentially acting like a BCB reader, she keeps up with the drama..

Time for a glorious and deliciously-violent game of kickball! Lucy still has it in her, she hasn’t lost her spark despite being stuck in a classroom for a few months.
Lucy’s so much fun to draw when she’s springy and competitive like this.. especially since she always carries that semi-pissed expression on her cute little face.

All’s well that ends well.. except not.
I’ve been smacked before by balls during kickball in order to get me out.. although it was on my back at the worst. Which wasn’t too bad, honestly! Unlike poor Tess.
Lucy gets a taste of the anger within the sophomores.. why are they so mad..

Kicking the ball far enough that it hits the wall equals a home run, for those puzzling out what on earth happened in the first panel.
Such a heated argument being allowed to last this long would be unrealistic if not for the fact that the teacher genuinely doesn’t give a damn.. hell, she enjoys listening to her students bicker! It’s her own way of watching soaps since she can’t watch them at home right now!
Nobody likes party-poopers, Sue!

Paulo doesn’t care, he’ll do what he wants! Just watch him, sophomores!
He really is a ride or die kinda bro, isn’t he!
.. but is Daisy the same
author_commentary.oliver: I quite like this characterisation of Jessica and Rachel. And how it INTRIGUES Daisy.

author_commentary.veronica:
ROSEVILLEEEEEEEEEEEEEE HIGH, home of the bumblebees!
Abbey, you could literally just waltz in with blood all over your face and some of your friends would STILL be like “.. huh, something’s a bit off about this guy”.
I guess it’s excusable because Mike is too busy getting sensory overload.

I was originally gonna make up a song for Roseville High School.. but I didn’t feel like writing something like that :( SONGS/POETRY ARE JUST NOT MY THING, SORRY. They’d probably be doing the pledge of allegiance anyway because they live in a fictional US that still indoctrinates their children lmao
Lucy doesn’t want to sing, but you can see the gym teacher forcing her in panel four. That used to happen to students who didn’t want to recite the pledge of allegiance back when I used to go to High School. The teacher would glare at them or even stop and order them to go along.. so that’s what’s happening to Lucy in the pep rally. Gym teachers are the worst, aren’t they?
I still remember one kid refusing to stand up because they were against the Iraq War. Man, I hope that person is doing well out there. The gym teacher got them in trouble, I think? But the kid remained sitting, sticking to their morals. What a chad. Meanwhile I got up because I didn’t wanna be in trouble and wasn’t very conscious about what was going on with the world ;\_\_; No convictions, no braincells.

Daisy practiced that routine SO MUCH, only to be shown up by Lucy, AGAIN! Can this poor girl catch a break!!!!!!
(.. I mean, to be fair to Lucy, Daisy, Lucy is being shown up by Sandy existing. Maybe you should accept that too!!!!)

I like that Lucy literally doesn’t care, it’s just some underwear! Half the time we’re just wearing accessories and nothing else, you guys, get with the program!
This segment of the chapter was considerably rewritten because I wanted to find a good way to get Tess up on stage that wasn’t hackneyed or forced, and I thought her family donating computers (as they did in the previous version) was super lame because you should be thanking her parents for doing that, not her! It doesn’t make any sense!!! What a random thing to get her on stage for!
Meanwhile I remember pep rallies having nonsense teacher-vs-student games and I can see Tess participating in those, but not wanting to actually speak.. and being shoved into an uncomfortable situation by another, bitter student. I just felt that sequence flowed better.
author_commentary.oliver: It was also pretty fun rewriting the taunts and jeers, I think.

author_commentary.veronica:
Just take the L, Tess!!!!!!!!!!!!
You can’t control this, principal!!!!
author_commentary.oliver: Oh, the real Daisy comes out! Watch yourselves.

author_commentary.veronica:
Well, that was an eventful pep rally! Let’s all hang outside and think about what we’ve learned today.
Lucy’s not taking any of your sad feefees crap, Tess!!!!!!! I like that Lucy’s just speaking her mind and being abrasive, meanwhile Mike wants to be nice, good, supportive caring friend. Maybe it’s okay to like your friends while still being a bit disappointed in them.
Anyway.. uhh.. hey, Jay. You look like you had fun.

You don’t think, Tess? Maybe it’s worth thinking about.. I think you might be onto something, actually..
I used to be bothered by Mike’s original line of “this is the closest Lucy will get to saying that she likes you” because come ON, she’s not a robot! She’s expressed genuine kindness in the past! She definitely has trouble with being upfront about certain things, but if you want some bluntness, you absolutely get it from Lucy. She’s also reached out to people like Daisy in the past, and she’s certainly been there for Mike A LOT!
The earlier dialogue just felt like generic dialogue you would say about a tsundere. I feel what he says now makes sense now, even though it still doesn’t give Lucy enough credit.
author_commentary.oliver: And, after all, Mike’s speaking from his own Lucy experiences.

author_commentary.veronica: Aww, Rachel.. always a sweetheart, even though you were first introduced as an angry Tess-slapper. You are a thoughtful slapper!

I really love Katie in this. A pretty awful influence in general, but what she says makes sense! You either try to get it or you accept you lost! Daisy clearly doesn’t want to accept she lost.. even though she has.
Anyway, what a wonderful conclusion to a chapter about yelling at your friends!!!!!

37.1.title: Birthday Double-Team
37.1.description: Paulo and Chirpy are celebrating their birthdays together with disastrous results.

author_commentary.veronica:
Hello, and welcome to yet another birthday chapter! We haven’t had one of those in a while, the last time we had that it was Lucy’s birthday, I think! Now we’re allllll the way in April!
.. wait, I just realised David has an entire chapter dedicated to his birthday, which is in February, so it hasn’t been that many months actually.
In April, there are two birthdays: Paulo and Chirpy. They’re both pretty important, but I didn’t wanna bother making two comics based on them, so I decided to combine their party! That’s why Chirpy thought everyone forgot.. considering her birthday is a few days before Paulo’s.
You just had to be patient, Chirpy! It’s not like you’re a main character!
David what are you doing getting stuff like this

David where on earth did you BUY THAT!!!!!!
The spreads are of women holding hands, OKAY? >8(

38.title: Rising Temperature
38.description: Abbey reveals his hidden nature. Meanwhile, Daisy invites Mike to a carnival, and all seems to be going as planned…

author_commentary.veronica:
Things are looking up for Tess and Paulo!!! They seem to be in la-la land when it comes to the prom. I guess there’s not much time left before junior prom happens so they really gotta prepare!
Isn’t it terrible when you’re sometimes so distracted by something you like that you realize you have something really important due? I remember that happened to me once or twice in high school.. I assumed work wasn’t due because there was vacation or something special.. so yeah. Poor Paulo!

Man, Paulo is a lucky guy to have befriended a bunch of brainiacs he can leech off of using his charming personality!
.. Okay, well, he got Mike’s support at least, And Abbey wants to get support from Mike, I suppose.
Wow, Mike really is the backbone of society, huh.

Katie whyyyyyyyyy, I know you were always mean and nasty, but you didn’t have to do this :( You seemed interested enough in Daisy’s boy troubles, now you won’t get a front row seat to it anymore!
We love a girlboss with pure honesty..

Abbey to the rescueeee.. or not.
Mike is trembling in the end because of his sensitive hearing, he wasn’t actually SCARED of Abbey, but anyone screaming is enough to frighten him.
These boys need to get better at paying attention to friends who are not love interests! Though it’s funny I say that when one big reason Abbey is paying attention to Daisy is because.. she is a love interest. BOY HOWDY.

Kevin kept giving me Lackadaisy vibes when I first designed him.. I SERIOUSLY WASN’T INTENDING FOR THAT if anyone thinks that way.. he’s just a weird cat leave me alone ;\_\_;
When I initially introduced this storyline of Abbey’s, I mistakenly wrote that Kevin and Janet were Abbey’s “foster parents”? For, what, four freaken years? Is that possible?! Either way, that sounds like a temporary assignment when I didn’t intend for it to be that way! So it’s been rewritten for Abbey to be full-on adopted by them! They’re his parents!

I guess it’s here where we reveal a SCIENTIFIC FACT in the Bittersweet Candy Bowl universe — cats and dogs cannot reproduce. It isn’t a matter of race.. or breed.. it’s just a matter of what kind of ANIMAL you are. So yeah.. you either marry someone you love of the same species and have kids.. or marry someone you love of a different species.. knowing that you can’t have babies. TOUGH DECISIONS.
If I were to make these characters all human, I guess Janet or Kevin (Or both?) would be infertile? Though I know the “cats and dogs can’t have babies” rule creates trouble for one relationship in the comic down the line BECAUSE of that roadblock.. what would be the excuse for that relationship never blossoming, then, I wonder..
Anyway, I’m getting WAY ahead of myself!

It’s very interesting how early into the comic Abbey hates Paulo, like downright doesn’t get along with him. Paulo hasn’t really been too kind to Abbey, to be fair!
Panel five, for example, would go much differently for Mike. Abbey feels humiliated and taunted, Mike on the other hand would think it’s nice Paulo is hugging him even though he’s taunting, Mike sees through the bravado and sees genuine affection. I guess that’s where their perspectives differ..
author_commentary.oliver: Careful, Mike, you’ve pushed the button!

author_commentary.veronica: Man this is such a complicated web.. you don’t think Mike already puts a lot of pressure on himself, Abbey??

FIGHT FIGHT FIGHT FIGHT
In the original version of this comic, I made Molly quite frail and weepy, like totally innocent and vulnerable.. but Molly really isn’t like that, personality-wise. Maybe when she was a baby, but the Molly we see later has a lot of confidence so I felt it much more fitting for her to come in angry and defiant (though still crying!)
I also like Mike being all “Uhh, you didn’t see that” (being his claws) rather than his dramatic LOOKING TO THE SIDE in the final panel, he’s just plain embarrassed in this revised version, as he should be!
The stress really is getting to poor Daisy! Her curls :(

OH SNAP.
It’s Final Fantasy Cat.
go forth one-winged angel

Damn Augustus you’re convincing ME!!!!!!
He’s really on the ball!
author_commentary.oliver: Time to KILL SANDY.

author_commentary.veronica: Mike is a genuinely nice person capable of goodness. He’s just an oblivious idiot sometimes, getting carried away in his own dramas. Abbey spoke a lot of sense back there to make Mike conscious about how he’s just not interested in Daisy’s feelings, but Mike isn’t a horrible person.. nor is Abbey.

The date is set.. tomorrow’s gonna be quite the party!
We’re leading to a season finale of sorts. It always felt like that to me, and you don’t have to wait a week for it! On to the next chapter!

39.title: Love My Way
39.description: Tess and Paulo go to prom while Daisy and Mike go to the carnival. Two perfect nights go horribly wrong.

author_commentary.veronica:
EYYYYYYYY, LOVE MY WAY!!!! A very good “final” chapter of Volume One (Even though, I know, Summer Vacation comes after it, but Summer Vacation kinda stands on its own, don’t you think? I always felt that way, honestly.. like some sorta OVA after a season finale.)
Strap yourselves in for some chaos!!!!!
It was around this time in the original version that I really wanted to accentuate Daisy’s curls more. I noticed that a lot of the characters when drawn in black-and-white looked very samey, so I started trying to differentiate them visually.
author_commentary.oliver: Lucy’s aloofness is a bit of a subtle joke here.

author_commentary.veronica: You should be more like Mike, Paulo! Not have a care in the world.. though it’s obviously because Mike doesn’t see this as an actual date..

Tess’ dress design was actually from her creator, Lily! Thank you, Lily!!!
I really like the parallel effect I did here, you can see as I’m slowly introducing proper panels to certain scenes that I felt like switching to proper panels was necessary. The grid comics were holding me back too much!
author_commentary.oliver: They don’t last too much longer.

author_commentary.veronica: Please excuse all my Parappa references hahahahah

Oh, Tess. When do you not hold deep dark secrets?
It’s interesting when you work with someone else’s character. When Tess was given to me, she came with a lot of background information, like her relationship with Roger, her reputation at school, and I was there to pretty much fill in the blanks and adjust her to the setting/my characters. I didn’t really want to rewrite what was given to her, you know? Otherwise why don’t I just make an entirely new character? I sought feedback from Lily how I was depicting Tess, and it was a fun exercise, honestly!
I do like how in this rewritten version, the rumours sound more like genuine rumours rather than people infodumping garbage onto Paulo. Now it’s more confusing and not very reliable! You don’t know what to believe!

PAULO DID YOU SPIKE THE PUNCH WITH DRAMA AGAIN
It’s kinda horrifying that Tess acknowledges the rumour but doesn’t fully confirm it or talk about it!! I guess she’s understood at this point that there’s no point trying desperately to debunk the rumours because people will continue spreading, and it just becomes an impossible game of telephone. You just hope that the people around you who care about you will believe you and be on your side!
It’s nice to see Tess put her foot down because of the age difference.. Paulo is kind of in over his head and even though Tess likes him very much, they’re in such different stages of their life.
author_commentary.oliver: Or about to be. There’s something melancholic about Paulo’s futile “it can work if we try!”

author_commentary.veronica:
White boys can’t dance. \*Hit\*
I don’t even know if Paulo would be a white guy if he were human! I always imagined him to be like.. Hispanic or Italian, basically not white.
Which means he has the potential to be a good dancer :)
Getting a little salty there, Paulo!!!! You should take no for an answer, dude!
What a way to send off this ship.

So, I wonder how Mike and Daisy are doing! They’re probably doing the most cliche activities to do in a carnival!
Those little bands around their right arms are those “Free ride” bracelets.. the kind Daisy was mentioning in “Rising Temperature.” They didn’t leave a hospital, I swear!
I still feel really proud of the way I set this whole sequence up, so much is happening! The works!!! And you can see Daisy getting more and more frisky throughout the night :l Not really to Mike’s liking.
author_commentary.oliver: Lots of little details updated across this page. We hope the long-time readers enjoy them.

author_commentary.veronica: Mike is doing his best here, being a monogamous boy and all! Daisy is showing some pretty startling manipulation tactics, I wonder where she learned it all?

Learn some damn boundaries, Daisy!
No dialogue, whoa :O
Wow, you sure have some unfinished business with Sandy, don’t you Daisy? Where did all this come from?

ACCESS DENIED, HARLOT.
Lord this is so embarrassing.

This is some ridiculous 4D chess you’re playing here, Augustus.
Sending a girl off to be sorely and painfully rejected by her crush only for you to swoop in and pick up the pieces.. I guess the only thing you have going for you when it comes to this plan is being so confident in yourself!

Smooth, Final Fantasy Cat. Real smooth.
So, Daisy, what’s this about your own self-confidence? You think nobody wants you, as two boys pull ridiculous stunts for your affection.
I mean, to be fair, you should gain some confidence at being liked, but also get some damn restraining orders.
Ohhhh, he said the “F” word!

I really like Final Fantasy Cat in the third panel.. and pretty much his douchebaggery throughout this chapter. I’m not even intending to make him evil! Just bitterly honest.. I have kind of a thing for people like that :-[
Man, Augustus, you do so much research into people’s lives for emotional warfare. You should become a detective..

Speaking of predictable trademarks! Yes, that’s a scar.
And no, it didn’t just pop up out of nowhere.. the really funny thing is that his scar has always been there.. even when Final Fantasy Cat was a side character hitting on Daisy. Everything ended up clicking together as I started really properly planning the comic out.
Anyway.. huh, scars. Remind of you someone?
Poor Abbey! this makes me feel so bad honestly ;\_\_; He really doesn’t want to be a bad guy, but he just keeps snapping. And seems to have no resources to not.. do that? As much?

Abbey’s story is too hardcore to be explained in the first panel.
Anyway, a lot has happened!!!! I guess we’ll see how the cast will handle this.. in the future!!!!!

40.title: Moving On
40.description: With freshman year coming to a close, everyone looks back with a sense of relief.

author_commentary.veronica:
It’s funny how I always refer to Love My Way as the season finale to Volume One, yet this chapter exists on its own! I guess this is a dynamic similar to “Aftermath” vs “Confrontation”.. everyone sees “Confrontation" as this big giant chapter that really shakes things up, but “Aftermath" is pretty necessary for showing how everyone gets “back to normal” afterwards.
This was originally meant to be the final page of “Love My Way”, but “Love My Way” was getting too long.
I feel it was a good fresh start!

Wow, time keeps marching on! It’s already the end of freshman year????
Mike is such an endlessly forgiving person, even though Daisy kept OBLITERATING his boundaries. At least she knows not to do that again, and Mike still wants to be in her life and be a better friend. I think people have expressed annoyance in the past that Daisy was never taken to task for what she did, but Mike.. isn’t really the type to do that. Unless he’s REALLY pushed far enough, and I mean, he took her to task in “Love My Way” itself! Daisy is making it really clear she won’t do it again and that’s all Mike is looking for!

I’m gonna miss some of these teachers! We’ll probably see some of them again in the future since the characters are not switching to new buildings or anything. Some English teachers teach multiple years! So it’s not a COMPLETE farewell to all of them!
Paulo getting domesticated by Tess, what a change.
I did not realize this until after it was drawn, but Lucy in the final panel is pulling an exact Franziska von Karma pose.

IT’S THE END!!!
I guess the advantage of dating someone a year higher than you is that if it ends badly, at least they get to piss off before you! Tess is gonna have a cozy senior year now with no more Roger!
.. Well, cozy if she isn’t constantly hounded by the sophomores (now juniors) of her past. Will they continue? We shall see!

Daisy and Abbey are bondiiiing~
At least something wholly positive came out of “Love My Way”, this is the help Abbey desperately needed. Hopefully his journey isn’t too rocky!
Glad to see these kids actually talking to their parental figures, too!
author_commentary.oliver: Sayonara, grid comics. I like to think final-two-panels Daisy is thinking of them.

41.title: Invitation
41.description: Tess asks everyone to join her on an overseas trip. She’ll stop at nothing to get a “yes” from Mike and Lucy.

author_commentary.veronica:
THE SUMMER VACATION ARC!!!!!! Lord was I really looking forward to making this at the time. I had SO MANY IDEAS, SO MANY PLANS.
.. A lot of plans I canned and rewrote, which was honestly a very new thing to me at this stage! For many previous chapters I just drew whatever popped into my head, but by this time I was PLANNING AHEAD!!!!! Which allowed me to figure out what ideas are not worth putting on paper!! Damn!!!
I made literal REFERENCES for characters! I was being a bonafide professional comic arteest..
Also, say goodbye to the grid-comic format! Proper panels are here to stay!
author_commentary.oliver: This was a complex chapter for the omnibus project. I wanted to integrate the Summer Vacation chapters with the Volume Two ones in terms of style, which was hard enough when Summer Vacation was pencil-shaded… but this particular chapter, “Invitation”, had pencil “inks”! So it required a lot of drawing over to get it up to scratch.

author_commentary.veronica:
Oh Paulo, when will you get over Tess.
You might have noticed a change with the art! Hopefully what appears to be a downgrade? ;\_\_; Just a smidge? Not enough to be hideous and bad and sticking out like a sore thumb?
While I edited a lot of the expressions/poses/etc, Summer Vacation and onwards are not getting complete and utter redraws unlike the grid-comic pages. It didn’t feel as necessary here. It would also mean the Omnibus woulda taken.. like.. two more years to make. It would have been ridiculous. It was already ridiculous enough I redrew all of Volume One!
So the art isn’t going to be as strong for a while since I pretty much just tweaked a lot of areas and the colours were changed to match the aesthetic of Volume 2. I hope this is okay!! I still think Summer Vacation looks great!!! And the tweaks/edits/dialogue changes have made it even better!

I mentioned a few pages earlier that I drew up a ton of references at the time I made the Summer Vacation arc, right? Abbey was a character that went through SO MUCH REVISION. I really hated his original design, it felt very out of place to the rest of the cast.
So before the Summer Vacation arc started I tried to design an Abbey that felt more a part of the rest of the cast. I feel I was very successful with that!! He’s much cuter now with ears that make more visual sense, not looking like a gangly bug-eyed freak anymore lmao
Lucy, you can have more than one friend, you know..
author_commentary.oliver: She’s so dedicated!

author_commentary.veronica: I like how Lucy sees any form of kindness as “Hmm, perhaps this person wants to be with me"

HELL YEAH SPINDASH THE KIDNAPPER AWAY, LILY!!! YOU CAN DO IT!!! Collect some emeralds!
lmao mike “JUST DEAL WITH IT”, it sounds like he’s being rude, but he’s just being pragmatic! There’s nothing he can do!!! No space!!

If the last page wasn’t MikexLucy enough..
So snug and cozy! I guess all the rustling would have tired them out sooner or later, but now they have burning fury all over again! Thanks, sunlight!
Come on, Lucy, everyone sees it!

Damn, Tess, you’re incredibly nice!
It’s nice to have friends that don’t just expect you to pay for things because you have money. I’m sure the idea of Tess financing a trip for Mike to see Sandy would have NEVER have crossed his mind! She has the ability to, but why would you expect that??

C’mon, when Augustus acts like this it’s villainous, but when Lily does it it’s OKAY???
Just pulling those damn strings!

Lily why are you being so smug about torturing this child…
I guess Lily was expecting Lucy to come around and finally be frank, but Lucy’s a very tough egg to crack!!!!
lmao Lucy just.. casually breaking Tess’ arm like that. She had it coming!

I really like how Sandy’s reason is eyebrow-raising, it’s kind of intended to be that way! They don’t really know that much about Sandy, and she’s meant to be in the same grade as Mike and Lucy! Europe on business? What is she DOING?
author_commentary.oliver:
We shall see!
A quick omnibus note: readers might have noticed it’s Silvershore Islands, no longer Acapulco. I thought it better to stay consistent with the fictional place names to come. Plus it seems to be a more Hawaiian kind of trip? No need to reference a specific place in Mexico that really isn’t represented in the vacation to come.

author_commentary.veronica:
A Mike finally takes the bait.. and Lucy tags along in as well. Nice domino effect! Lily is pleased. All according to plan..
Well, all according to Tess’ original plan.
You can’t escape now, Abbey!
author_commentary.oliver: I like Daisy’s pep, here.

author_commentary.veronica: Damn, Tess, a private plane??? They don’t have to go through airport security and all that junk? How good is it having money, means you have a lot of plot conveniences and you make things convenient for me to DRAW!!!!!!

Abbey is liked so much that he gets a pirate bear as a gift. Isn’t that the best?
Man, Paulo still has VHS tapes. Those things are totally extinct these days!
Yes, gang.. leave Abbey and Daisy to their own adventures.
I’m sure Tess can buy McCain a few bits of clothing here and there!! He’ll be fine!!! We’ll all be fine!!!
author_commentary.oliver: Just drag him in. It’s no problem!

author_commentary.veronica:
Abbey and Daisy seem like such sweetheart childhood friends, I totally thought that in this final page. So pure! So wholesome!
Hope you enjoyed this chapter! See you in the future! The next chapter will be quite ace.

42.title: Arrival
42.description: The group arrives at the Islands and meets an awkward new friend.

author_commentary.veronica: I was really trying to experiment with a more rubbery, Sonic-esque style when I made this chapter. I really love the way Paulo and David’s legs look in the final panel, I feel I really nailed that!! A kinda.. Panty and Stocking aesthetic. Hell yeah.
author_commentary.oliver: This one has my fav new colour scheme.

author_commentary.veronica: Speaking of cartoony anatomy, I also attempted at more cartoony expressions! Whoaaaa teeth. Also I am in love with Lucy’s expression on panel eight. She’s so cute!
Something about that cat.. what is her secret..
Tess, if you guys lived in Australia, you’d still be underage but the drinking age would at LEAST be much closer!!! The rich can do whatever they want..
author_commentary.oliver: I bet she didn’t even turn her phone off!

author_commentary.veronica: I think I’ve explained to Souppy like 20 times during the many years since this comic was made that I am making an Azumanga Daioh reference in the last three panels!!!!!!!
author_commentary.oliver: I’m sorry. But at least confused readers can know where to look to figure it out!

author_commentary.veronica: I kept thinking of Mike Meekins when I drew the luggage boy. So very full of references!
Pretty sad to see Paulo go from lovestruck excitement for Tess to animosity and annoyance. Tess has (understandably) not been giving him any hope so he’s moved on to lashing out.

One fun fact is that when I first sketched out this page, I inked like 50% of the comic and left it for months.. and that scene with Tess talking to Lily in the second panel was uninked because I was challenged by the perspective and wanted to return to it later.
Towels are used to dry hair and that includes moist.. fur. My hair doesn’t wear clothes, but I put a towel on it after showering anyway. THAT IS WHY LUCY IS WEARING A TOWEL THANK YOU VERY MUCH
Looking like a freaken disney princess, speaking of which.
Man, if it wasn’t for Lucy’s pets coming along on the trip, Tess might have been permanently kicked out by Lucy! Thank you Lily for opening the door!
Lucy, get your mind out of the gutter!!!
What are you so worried about, Mike!! This version of Paulo was very apologetic and understanding of his flaws!!!
Even now, Mike won’t stand for his pillow being taken.

David’s just upset that he couldn’t share the room with Paulo :(
Honestly, why didn’t Tess pair David and Paulo? They woulda had a blast! McCain and Mike woulda had a very chill time, too.
Poor Mike :( He just wants to grill.
I like that poor McCain is still trying to get his eight hours, but David messes him up every step of the way.
I guess it’s time to wake up, McCain :( At least Paulo and David are pals again!!!

Sorry, David, when in Rome~
I was referencing the dress Asuka wears in Evangelion with Lucy’s outfit here. It’s meant to be yellow!
I’m sure many people will get this obvious reference. For those who don’t, I am disowning you.
For the short amount of time that dog girl was there, I thought that Paulo and her would be very cute together. Too bad Tess is a JERK.
author_commentary.oliver: Not very good gf material if she ditches you after the first volleyball to the face…

author_commentary.veronica:
Oh god I’m reading Yashy’s line in Tails’ voice, I can’t stop..
You coulda kept walking, stranger!
author_commentary.oliver: Yashy had a hard life.

author_commentary.veronica:
What a good mother Lucy is, saving Yashy to her own detriment!
I guess lifeguards are too busy not doing their job, but to be fair it’s not like Lucy is being pulled away into the sea. Though some water might start going up her nose if the shifting tides have a say in this.
GET AWAY CREEP.

Lead the way, mysterious stranger!
Man, Tess’ volleyball did a number to Paulo’s head! Maybe he fell over onto some glass. Beaches can be pretty dirty sometimes! Always remember to take your trash with you, kids!
Lucy is delightfully awkward to speak to.
author_commentary.oliver: She’s not wrong in the last panel…

author_commentary.veronica:
Not only are his actions impulsive, but his manner of speaking is as well! Poor guy, he doesn’t intend to come off so creepy!
This character went through several transformations ever since his concept came to my mind. During the designing phase, he looked way too much like the cat version of one of my friends, which wasn’t my intention.. so I tried to veer away from it. He was originally called “surfercat” because he looked like a surfer.. and honestly, my friend looked like a surfer too!!!
This character is not a surfer, though, so I altered his appearance to change that. We will find out what he’s truly about soon enough!
A CHALLENGER APPEARS!

The first flashback with Zachary in the final panel has him giving a girl he thinks is homeless $100.. but she’s really playing a trick on him and her brother is gonna sling-shot him in the face. The rest is just him being obsessed with his dream of finding the next great musician. And trying to protect the weak. Zachary means well, he just doesn’t think!

Aww, Catherine and Zachary.. the perfect pair. They ring familiar bells, only Catherine is not struggling with a ton of emotional baggage, lol
But they definitely look like a chilled out, more comfortable version of.. two certain characters.
author_commentary.oliver: Mike’s a little rude here!

author_commentary.veronica: For those who don’t remember, yes. Yashy still does not know about Sandy. And maybe it would benefit Mike a lot to finally let Yashy know about her, but he knows the way Yashy is.. it would be a very frustrating thing to explain to her. I guess better to leave that conversation to another day.

And we’ve reached the end!! What a nice meeting, I think everyone has learned a valuable lesson tonight!
And as for Lucy, she has earned some valuable cash :^)
Onwards we go!

43.title: Search and Rescue
43.description: When Mike goes missing, Lucy’s dependency problem is stripped bare.

author_commentary.veronica:
Mike got rid of his scarf while Paulo was reminiscing, as he is getting ready for bed. That is my excu-- reasoning as to why it disappears. Ain’t nobody the wiser.
.. I honestly can’t believe that after revising and editing and revamping the Omnibus, I STILL overlooked this error! I mean.. I’m not wrong, still! Mike coulda just taken the scarf off! They’re getting ready for bed and Mike doesn’t sleep wearing his scarf! It makes total sense!
THAT IS WHAT IS CANONICAL AND I’M STANDING BY IT.
author_commentary.oliver: What’s with all these bandages?!

author_commentary.veronica: Being a bit prickly there, aren’t you Mike.. Lucy wasn’t even trying to agitate you.
author_commentary.oliver: Oh. I guess we’ll find out about the bandages…

author_commentary.veronica:
Paulo is such a showoff that he likes hanging off edges of a cliff. What a master climber!
I like that he continues to validate Tess’ rejection to her, in a way he’s being aggressive to her BECAUSE she rejected him, though. If she didn’t reject him he wouldn’t be nearly as obnoxious!
Lucy cannot reject a challenge from him!!!
Kapow!
I really like way David fell, it looks like it really hurt though!!!! Full on back-smack!

ooooohhhhh utilising panel borders to depict scenes of a story
I am a master comic arteest now.
author_commentary.oliver:
Vero’s making fun of herself but I think it’s pretty cool! The Summer Vacation arc basically represented the time Vero was doing wild and interesting things with panel layouts as she got used to them and started to mess with the rules for narrative effect. A lot of it holds up really well!
… Even if it was a nightmare to straighten all the unruled lines going every which way ;\_;

author_commentary.veronica: Oh goodness do I remember trying so hard with the fifth panel. You know it’s kind of mega-hard to find references of people hanging from cliffs at this angle. I wonder why.

SHUT
IT
MCCAIN

One of the toughest pages to make, which one of my closer friends was praising like no other. Whooo!!! So proud
.. I said in the past, though in the present now I get people all “UMM DO YOU KNOW PHYSICS” DO I LOOK LIKE I KNOW PSYCHICS.
THIS IS JUST A COOL THING MIKE DID, OKAY. BADASS!!!!! LOOK AT HIM GOOOOO. It looks awesome in my mind!!!
author_commentary.oliver: A selfless guy for sure!

author_commentary.veronica:
Yeah, I don’t think you need to be acting calm, Paulo, given you’re the one that caused this..
Well, David also did. But it’s much easier to place the blame solely on you.

Good onya for winning KAPOW, David!
Lily sees a storm coming.. hopefully Mike is okay.
Why do you even want to try waking her up, David, she’s so much more relaxed unconscious! Let her rest!

What an unfortunate position to wake up in. Paulo genuinely didn’t mean any harm! David didn’t either, I guess other than to admire her fur. See, that’s why Katie cared so much about him once upon a time!
Lucy was Violetta Cadaverini in her past life.
author_commentary.oliver: I think I can guess the game Vero was playing when she wrote this commentary…

author_commentary.veronica: Zachary sure knows how to deal with awkward situations, eh?

RUN RUN RUN.
It’s so sweet that Catherine doesn’t even bother to deny that she’s Zachary’s girlfriend, there’s more pressing matters to attend to! No point arguing semantics! Now that’s a girl you should put a ring on.
author_commentary.oliver: Finally, the park bears!

author_commentary.veronica:
TOUGH ANGLES. ALL OVER. I wonder what kind of creature they’re running from anyway, a bear? Are bears conscious in the BCB world? Can they speak? Are they capable of thought?
.. Let’s not delve into that. THE LESS WE KNOW, THE BETTER.
David should work in forensics.

The thought of dunking her head in a lake was too much for poor widdle Lucy.
“Young love”, Lily???? Really?? You think this is a precious moment? You don’t think this is strange at all??!??!?!?!?! Lily?!?!??!?!

Isn’t that fish quite badass? Almost to the point where you’d want to dub it “Badass McFish”.
Good catch, Mike!
Aww, Sue and Mike are so sweet together ;\_\_; Sue is one of Mike’s oldest friends so this did affect her massively. It’s not just because of her little crush. They’re friends!
Break time~~~

The last page was supposed to show the passage of time. I needed to get to this scene without using up like twenty more pages explaining all the intricate details of everyone climbing back to civilization and meeting Catherine and all that good stuff.
We’re awake now, though! We were all following Lucy’s perspective!
author_commentary.oliver: Watch where you’re pointing that thing, Yashy!

author_commentary.veronica: PauloxBlur OTP
What’s going on, Mike..
author_commentary.oliver: What a serious fellow.

author_commentary.veronica:
David’s had Paulo’s prized stereo since seventh grade. With a stereo that awesome, who WOULDN’T wanna keep it?
Ugh, imagine getting melted marshmallow all over your fuzzy face. I guess for people who grow facial hair, imagine melty marshmallow getting all over your beard. Yashy is such a scoundrel.

Ohoh, what’s this then???
WE’LL FIND OUT.. NEXT TIME!

44.title: Intervention
44.description: Something is putting Mike on edge, while David confronts Paulo about his clash with Tess.

author_commentary.veronica: And we’re back! What’s gotten into Mike???? What’s wrong here???

You’ve been CAUGHT. RED-HANDED, BUSTER.
.. Honestly he got a fitting punishment for his snooping.
author_commentary.oliver: Yeah, gross!

author_commentary.veronica: Hey, Mike.. :( What’s going on? Buddy? Mike? :(

I think some readers thought Zachary said “yer real lucky, man” in an envious way? Like he wishes Lucy would feel that way about him? Which is not the case. Zachary is just saying that Mike is lucky for being loved in such a strong way by another person, he envies that kind of love, a love he wouldn’t want from Lucy at all!
Bitter? Trying to make up excuses? Just plain right? You tell me.
author_commentary.oliver: Harsh! What’s got into this guy.

author_commentary.veronica:
Sorry, Sue :( Those are the rules of truth or dare.. you can’t escape.
.. Though maybe you deserve to be humiliated with the last question if you go ahead and ask something as invasive as THIS! What were you even expecting, man? For a gal who doesn’t want drama, you sure are fishing for it!

Tess, please..
Honestly, I’m feeling as agitated as Paulo, even though Tess is right that her rejection is for his own good! But lord you’re really putting your foot in your mouth there, Tess.
I wish I could magically summon popcorn like Yashy.
Catherine is loving this. Giving her some CONSIDERATIONS. Some food for thought.

I wonder if Paulo was secretly hoping David would find him. It’s a pretty obvious area to sulk in!
Please move that bed back in its place or at least give the housekeepers a fat tip!!!!!
I was really experimental with these panel layouts when I first made them. Learning experiences that really taught me a lot. Sorry for these growing pains, everyone! But I admit it was really fun.

More experimental paneling! I love this page though because I really feel Paulo’s expressions just going with the flow so naturally. From mocking giggly flirty girls to getting really cranky. You’re really following him on his journey!
David is such an anti PauloxTess shipper lmao

Even Paulo thinks something’s wrong with Lucy’s little brain. Poor thing, she really wasn’t that bad before! But I guess a lot has happened..
Anyway, David was just providing some chit-chat before he brought out the BIG guns.

It’s so sad that Paulo sees Daisy as someone that he would ruin, like just a kid he should look after??? Really?? As David said, Daisy is literally older than Lucy.
.. Though, I mean, let’s be real you’re all kids.
LET’S GO
Paulo is not about this damn Tess slander! You watch your mouth, David!
Paulo doesn’t watch anime. That’s why he’s cool.
Mike has a pretty jammin’ stallion.

Aww, Abbey, you’re adorable! Souppy actually sought out assistance from a reader’s relative who studied YE OLDE MIDDLE AGE LANGUAGE, hence Abbey’s dialogue! Abbey wishes he could actually sound like this, let’s be honest.
author_commentary.oliver: All these words are so silly. But I think David would get them right.

author_commentary.veronica:
In my original script, Abbey was going to explain that Paulo can’t pull any tricks like grabbing someone to dress up as him so the monarchs are rescued at the same time.. the minute they notice anything suspicious like that, they’ll just lop off both girls.
But my editor (Souppy~~) thought it would be too much information so it was canned for something more generic in the seventh panel.
I mean, Paulo gets the point! He wouldn’t be the type to pro-strat imaginary situations like this, though.

OOOOOOOOOOH.
Paulo likes a girl, what is he gay?????
Man you’ve been thinking about this one a while, haven’t you, Paulo?

I originally had Paulo call Tess a bitch in the final panel, but Souppy didn’t let me! For good reason, honestly. The silent treatment is effective as it is.
That’s it for now! I felt this chapter is better being closed here. To be honest, this chapter and the next were originally meant to be combined, but I thought it was getting too long and this was the only place where a “to be continued” would be appropriate.
The next page is a scene change, so yeah. Stay tuned for that!

45.title: Return
45.description: It’s the final night of the trip, and everyone has found a different experience to take away.

author_commentary.veronica: Hello, everyone! We have completely changed scenes now! Get ready for a rollercoaster.

I don’t think Zachary is ever going to live down the creeper accusations, even if they are completely unwarranted!!!!
.. Well, it IS strange for this guy to be hanging around a bunch of teenagers, but he absolutely does not mean to do so in a creepy way. And besides, he WAS sought after during Search and Rescue! Zachary woulda never hung out with them by the bonfire if it wasn’t for Chirpy and Blur summoning him!
There is only so much that you can blame on his nosiness.. poor guy keeps getting dragged back.
Lucy’s getting pretty romantic here.
author_commentary.oliver: The king of unsolicited advice!

author_commentary.veronica:
I like that “Mike” is uttered and Lucy changes her tone ENTIRELY.
I wonder how helpful you’re being, Zachary!!!!!

Zachary sounds like a certain segment of the readerbase lmao!!!!!!
Though ultimately, it’s kind of a bit more complicated than just “be nicer”..

This page in particular helped me discover a flaw I tend to often stumble into: cone heads. This was most prevalent in the third to last panel. Whenever Lucy’s ears are down, she seems to develop a REALLY BIG FOREHEAD. Almost a cone head. I am going to make a mission to completely extinguish that habit, because of that panel alone.
(Not as relevant with more recent pages, but it used to be a habit I struggled with a lot!)

Zachary is really freaken serious right now.
Doesn’t the third to last panel just BREAK YOUR HEART?
Somehow!

Uh-oh.
Spaghetti-Os.
The fifth panel made me think of the Sonic 2 logo, with Sonic pointing his thumb away. I totally didn’t intend to do that!
author_commentary.oliver: I wonder what a beak brush looks like…

author_commentary.veronica:
Silent night.. holy night..
Lucy is getting pretty brave right now.
The tragedy of it all.
author_commentary.oliver: Awww…

author_commentary.veronica: ooh what’s all this then
author_commentary.oliver: Tess back in charge.

author_commentary.veronica: I always liked the effect in the last panel where they’re like.. in front of the sun, on a beach of sorts. It’s very sweet, they’re very sweet together!
author_commentary.oliver: It certainly gave me stereotypical Waikiki vibes.

author_commentary.veronica:
You sure that’s a good suggestion, Lily???? I suppose it’s so Lucy doesn’t have to keep all these bitter feelings inside and hopefully move on, but you really think Mike is going to choose her? After the way he’s acted this entire arc??
Honestly, maybe all this Daisy daydreaming was good for you and Tess in the long run, Paulo. I don’t think that would have helped Tess’ case for rejecting you..
WELL THAT WASN’T TIMED VERY WELL, DAVID.
Not in so many words, Paulo!

And there we finish with what might have been the longest arc in Bittersweet historyyyyy. Hope you enjoyed it, despite all its ups and downs!
There’ll be quite more emotional events to come, as Lucy has opened up a whole new storyline. A whole NEW can of worms.
Stay tuned!
author_commentary.oliver: Don’t call Daisy a worm!

46.title: New Beginnings
46.description: Something has sparked between Daisy and Abbey, and Lucy is curious to know what happened.

author_commentary.veronica:
Hello and welcome the more polished “Volume Two” style! Traditional lineart, digital colouring. Toning the background and shading the foreground. Enjoy the show!
The Summer Vacation arc was edited to fit the aesthetic of Volume Two in the Omnibus revamp, but this is the chapter where the Volume Two style actually officially started.
author_commentary.oliver: And for sure it was easier to edit! The inks actually existed! I recoloured every page regardless, and it looks a whole lot fresher.

author_commentary.veronica:
Probably one of the hardest pages I had to draw.. and not just because of that complicated final panel in which I try very very hard to draw a proper background! It’s a scene that played out in my head a lot when it came to Abbey’s story.
The more I talk about this, the more embarrassed I feel because there’s something oddly personal about it.. so I’m just gonna stop here!!!
Earth to Abbey!! Come back to us, Abbey!
Loyal little Daisy, spending her lovely summer’s day waiting around in a reception room.
OOH LET’S HAVE A PICNIC
author_commentary.oliver: What a lovely thing to do!

author_commentary.veronica: Hey, it’s these girls! Been a while!

It’s pretty sad that Daisy automatically assumed Jessica and Rachel were in the same camp as Katie after Katie told Daisy to leave her alone. Daisy didn’t notice how in reality, Katie was the “third wheel” and these cool older girls wanted to hang out with Daisy instead! Daisy needs to give herself more credit.
I think Daisy also overestimates Katie’s reach. To Daisy, Katie is still an unachievable amazing popular girl. But Jessica and Rachel don’t think Katie is all that!
author_commentary.oliver:
It’s amazing how much difference a year makes in high school. Nothing cool about people younger than you!
Except for Daisy. What a shining star.
(I love Rachel’s “bunny boy” here btw)

author_commentary.veronica: ABBEY WHY DO YOU MAKE THINGS SO DIFFICULT.

Epic cringe moment for poor Abbey :(
.. Fortunately Daisy didn’t notice that, because she was too busy thinking about the OTHER thing he said!

Oh, Daisy, you just want to be picked up and carried away on a glowing unicorn with your lover, don’t you? She is a big romantic and is angry the first person to ever confess his love for her is doing it so.. robotically. SO MEEKLY.
COWARDS. THE BOTH OF YOU.
There we go!!! That didn’t take so long!
author_commentary.oliver: Mwah!

author_commentary.veronica: Back to a blue present! And with Molly’s parting words, we finish off a delightfully awkward chapter! Hope you enjoyed! Stay tuned.. for the next one.

47.title: Pick Me Up
47.description: Lucy is struggling with her feelings, but Mike is sick of the whole game. Paulo picks up the pieces.

author_commentary.veronica: Panel one had to go through quite a bit of revision because I notice all I freaken draw all the time are trees.. so I wanted to draw good trees this time. Mike should become a hobo and live at the park. That’ll make my backgrounding 10 times easier!
author_commentary.oliver:
This is actually a secret nightmare page. You know how some webcomic artists never print their old stuff because they never drew their stuff at print resolution, the right DPI level? Well, we were smart enough to get on top of that, but in a FREAK ACCIDENT one of us saved over the full resolution version of this page.
And while I could recover the inks from a new scan, the shading was set in stone.. and we actually printed thousands of books with weird upscaled shading. I AM SORRY. For the omnibus, this page finally had its redemption — a full 600dpi reshading.

author_commentary.veronica: Unwarranted as Lucy’s reaction was, Mike REALLY wasn’t happy to see her. You could see it in his face.
author_commentary.oliver: They say you hurt those you love… or something.

author_commentary.veronica:
This chapter was originally written as a side story that I wouldn’t publish online. In the original sketch, this page is where the story began. After deciding I had a good idea going and wanted to make it canonical, I added the two previous pages to show how the argument started and why.
People think Mike’s become more of a jerk, but what kind of jerk deals with the same awkwardness since the age of five? Someone with the patience of a GOD.

Roseville’s got some far off mountains, hey. So scenic!
You can’t shake Paulo off that easily..
If there’s one thing Paulo one-ups Mike with is the fact he is never threatened by Lucy. He’s probably the most at ease with her. And it drives her CRAZY.
I mean, to be fair, who else would Lucy be having beef with? There’s like.. one other person she talks to. I don’t think Paulo is being much of a Sherlock Holmes!
I like that because Paulo thinks Lucy’s behaviour is cute and endearing, it means he expects everyone else to feel the same :-[ Maybe you just have better chemistry with Lucy, Paulo..

Paulo, you’re being so blunt! Oh my god!
Though it’s nice to see him giving her a good suggestion.. an apology???? In this comic???? Say it ain’t so!!!
What are you doing, you rude boy.

WHAT ARE YOU DOING, YOU RUDE BOY.
I guess Mike came in at the right time to break this up.
author_commentary.oliver: I love that little row of them finally spilling their feelings out at each other, here. So sweet.

author_commentary.veronica:
I really liked the concept of having an outsider looking into Lucy and Mike’s conflict. Zachary was the unbiased observer in the Summer Vacation arc, and if I have to admit something, before Zachary was created, Paulo was originally gonna fill Zachary’s shoes in the Summer Vacation arc!
I obviously changed that by creating an entirely new character, but Paulo always had that potential to be an observer of Mike and Lucy’s dynamic and able to give some.. slightly not biased criticism? Well, certainly less biased than Daisy. Okay, it’s pretty biased towards Lucy at the end of the day, but he’s honestly been very fair this chapter! And he’s called Lucy out a bunch! Let’s give Paulo some credit here!

This chapter went through a few evolutions! Originally it was part of Volume Three, so it was in colour, but when we were revamping for the Omnibus, we felt it fit into Volume Two a lot better, and so it had to be changed to a monochrome style to fit Volume Two’s aesthetic!
It’s the perfect plan!

Paulo wasn’t all that knowledgeable about the Lucy hydrophobia LORE, it seems! Does he seriously think she faints when she’s in the shower? Did he assume all this time Lucy never showered????
Anyway, I guess we all learned something today!

49.title: Wonderland
49.description: Lucy wakes up in a dreamy new world.

author_commentary.veronica:
Hello, everyone! It was this chapter that began the three-day-a-week update schedule we follow to this day!
