Every chapter before this one was uploaded in full whenever I finished it, so people used to wait days, weeks, and as the pages got more complex, *months* for the latest update. The gap was so long a lot of people thought I ended the comic before I updated with “Wonderland”!
I guess the advantage of that original update schedule was that once I updated, there’d be a ton of pages to read. By Summer Vacation the comic was getting more and more complicated and I was beginning to plan it out for the long-term.
So, uh, see you Wednesday! (Way back then.)
author_commentary.oliver: In fact, from this point onwards, some of the page commentary is going to be written in a more contemporaneous tone. It was also around here that commentary was written at the time the chapters were posted, and not written in bulk to fill out a huge archive. But don’t worry — Vero and I have looked it over and added and tweaked it in this new age of the first Omnibus!

author_commentary.veronica: You think you were gonna get an answer THAT easily??

Friday’s update leaves us at a CLIFFHANGER.
get it
This past week of coming back has been pretty awesome, thanks to everyone for the support! I guess we’re nearly ready to wrap up with this chapter. Hope you’ve enjoyed the show so far!

This one has quite a lot more happening than the others, I keep thinking this comic is going at a snail’s pace, then again posting one page at a time always kind of feels that way. OH WELL.
what is going onnnnnnn
And so we reach the end. New chapter starts next week, though it won’t be continuing in colour. We’ll return to standard Volume Two style again! Hope you enjoyed!

Hey, even more setting change! We’re progressing through the day, getting introduced to more familiar faces.
One thing I noticed in my High School was that teachers would repeat.. which is why three of the previous teachers have returned. It’s not ALL about being too lazy to design entirely different teachers! Why waste an already perfectly-designed adult?
Anyway, Mike, you’re such a nerd. And a showoff!!!!

barkbarkbarkbarkbarkbark
It feels kind of odd that the next time this comic updates, I will be 22. Too old to be drawing comics about melodramatic cats? You be the judge!

depends on how conscious about it I am.

Anyway.. yeah…
This is kind of what Lucy shoulda expected. I don’t think she ever had a chance so long as Sandy was in the picture.. though Mike has definitely soured on Lucy in recent times. At least he’s being nice here!
Thanks for reading!

Souppy and I kind of clashed with the end of this comic, like I completely misinterpreted his script and had something mildly different in mind, but I changed it. I initially drew Sandy with a very somber expression, but Souppy wanted something more.. hopeful? Okay? A little sad, but not quite? Maybe things will be okay?
But the purpose of the comic was not to provide a huge revelation about Sandy, it was more to just.. show a bit of the current Sandy. Show what she does, possibly why she’s always so busy, what drives her and how close she is to Mike.
But yeah, I would get people all WHAT IS SANDY’S DEAL and there you have it. Once again thank you Souppy for the script!
Stay tuned for a.. quite different kind of chapter on Monday!
author_commentary.oliver: Looking back on it, I think it worked out well! But it’s obviously a bit understated and supposed to lay the groundwork for this character who comes in and out of the story, so I don’t want to expound on it too much here. I feel for her, though! Don’t you?

59.title: Rehearsal
59.description: Sue’s script calls for a little more than Lucy wants to reveal. But there’s always the privacy of your own room, right?

author_commentary.veronica:
Look! New style! The beginning of Volume Three.
This chapter was originally a bit of a test run to see if I could make the switch to drawing fully in colour. And it worked out okay! BCB is going to be in colour from now on! Goodbye, toned monochrome style!
Anyway onto our tsundere special featuring lucy
author_commentary.oliver:
Out of everything we rebuilt for the omnibus, Volume Three pages were some of the toughest. Basically, Vero really disliked her old colouring, and it wasn’t very appropriate for printing either, with all sorts of RGB-based colours that become murky and unpleasant when printed into a book. The only solution was to recolour it all!
Like a lot of the omnibus tasks, it was a collaborative effort. The result is a whole lot more pleasant to look at online and off.

author_commentary.veronica:
I remember feeling pretty excited about these pages when I was making them. I felt the colours were looking pretty good!
In retrospect, I got so frustrated about my colour theory after we had to put Volume Three into print. I wasn’t thinking about print at the time so the thought of viewing the pages in a CMYK preview never crossed my mind :l
Nice to see you too, Jordan!

Thanks for reading~~~~~ This was pretty short, wasn’t it! It was just meant to be a comic saying YES GUYS I REMEMBER I HAVE A PLAY PLOT POINT GOING ON IN THE BACKGROUND BEHIND ALL THIS DRAMA. Yesuree.

author_commentary.veronica:
BAWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW
This comic features a very.. vulgar Paulo. I think Volume Three is when that trait really started for him. It’s kinda weird to see it develop!
Paulo’s swearing follows my own journey I went through when it came to swearing. When I was a kid and early teenager, I NEVER swore. I would use word-replacements for swears. Often that affected my writing! I couldn’t have characters swear because *I* couldn’t swear!
A lot of the reason why a lot of the old Volume One dialogue was so wonky in the first place was because I had that affliction affect everything. I used to write formally. My brother told me once that using “cuz” instead of “because” in dialogue looked stupid, he thought “I dunno” looked sloppy compared to “I don’t know” so I HAD to write “because” and “I don’t know." God I had a lot of weird messed up rules.
So nobody could speak in slang, which affected characters like Paulo and Daisy considerably! That’s changed since then, of course, and I’ve been able to get characters to use words I don’t ever use, but feel fitting for them.
Anyway, there you go!

65.title: Dinner Time
65.description: Reeling from Mike’s cold shoulder, Lucy becomes a recluse in her own house.

author_commentary.veronica:
HEY EVERYBODY!!!
WELCOME TO A NEW CHAPTER!!!!!!!!!!
.. Or is it? *Some* of you may find this sequence veryyyyyy familiar…
It’s “Dinner Time”, a Bittersweet Club International member-exclusive chapter that takes place in the midst of Volume Three. When Souppy and I were working on the omnibus, we thought this was a very valuable chapter to include as part of the canon story, and so we posted it while that campaign was running, as a flashback. Now it’s in its rightful place in the archive, happening whe nit was supposed to happen!
Back when BCI started out, there were a few times I would draw canonical stories that honestly deserved to be real chapters! It happened with “Another Trip” (Remade into “Escape Route”), and it’s happened with Dinner Time now. It took a bit of time to settle on the AUs that fill the members’ archive now.
I always regretted Dinner Time being trapped behind a paywall, because there’s a lot of Lucy’s mother here, a character who’s not often depicted. This chapter shows that she was certainly aware something was up with Lucy, but felt a bit powerless about how she should deal with it, as she didn’t want to smother.
I have to admit I keep thinking of Jordan listening to something super noisy like Rammstein
She’s in too awful a headspace to even allow her pets to hang out with her! I find it terribly sad to look back on…
Even after being locked out, Chirpy hops on over to Lucy’s head ;\_\_\_\_; My heart.
Jordan’s a good way to provide distractions! Too obnoxious to allow Lucy to stay depressed for long!
god lucy chill

There is something incredibly funny about Yashy meekly apologising for her potty mouth because Lucy’s mother ends up calling it out. It really does revert Yashy to the baby that she actually is.
LILY!! CHIRPY!! YOU’RE LATE FOR DINNER!!

Man, Mike is so cute ;\_\_\_; He’s just trying his best.
This does make me cringe a bit because I can empathise with being told of times you were a dumb bratty kid and you just.. kinda wish you weren’t. You feel so much retrospective embarrassment. But ultimately we were all kids!!! We all had these little developing brains absorbing such a vast complex world.

Now Jordan unintentionally makes himself a good distraction from discussing Mike and what he might be doing to Lucy…
Snitches get stitches, Lucy!!!!! You are such a bad sister!

I love the exchanges in this page so much, what a whirlwind of emotions. It’s also nice for Jordan to address the events of [Another Shoulder](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c53/p9.html), because man for Paulo to be so kind and convincing to Lucy’s mother that she chose not to pick her up??? Trusting a BOY to let a GIRL sleep over at his HOUSE?? Madness.
I also love Yashy sticking to her eternal OTP (How dare you do anything that doesn’t have to do with Mike!!!!!!!)

Hormones, amirite fellas?
sam our ace king

Sam is Spongebob confirmed.
I do enjoy that you technically get to learn about Sam in this chapter even though he’s long moved out. And how the younger siblings felt about him.
Sam’s going places it seems!!! He’s just fine!

Paulo convinced you to let Lucy sleep over at his place in Another Shoulder, Lucy’s mother!!! And now you backpedal on that because Jordan said Paulo has had RELATIONS with other girls????
Honestly Lucy’s family needs to chill on their MikexLucy tendencies lmao
More embarrassing memories to make your stomach churn, especially given current circumstances :l
OH HELLO BLUR SO NICE OF YOU TO JOIN US
BYE BLUR YOU IDIOT LMAO
Jordan’s passiveness in these pages really makes me feel for the poor guy later on.
Goodnight, Lucy.

THANKS FOR READING EVERYONE!!!!
I hope you enjoyed this little time capsule!!! I thought this was a very fun chapter full of very interesting conversations and a lot of development, so I was glad to share it with this public audience!

It’s kind of hard to write commentary when you want the comic to speak for itself. I hope it sets something up nicely! If you know these characters well enough, you’ll understand what’s going on here.

author_commentary.veronica:
Aww, Chris, you’re adorable!!!! Little baby-boo!!
I had a very weird complex over the main characters’ siblings when I was very little. Basically, I thought the youngest sibling is going to die last (because of their age), so for some reason I didn’t want the youngest sibling to be a boy?? Or for a main character to not be the youngest sibling? I guess because I projected myself into the youngest siblings and I didn’t want to die??
God even as a very young child I had awful agonising thoughts about mortality. What’s wrong with me
ANYWAY, I remember I created a younger sister for Lucy, but panicked at the thought of Lucy dying before her, so I made the younger sister admit in the next comic that not only is she OLDER than Lucy, but she’s Lucy’s cousin.
What am I getting at? What I’m getting at is that in the original series I made when I was a child, Mike had a baby sister. Like a real baby. I think her name was Crystal? I actually forget what her name is now.. it’s been so long since I thought about her.
Even though the thought of Lucy dying before anyone else horrified me, I was totally okay with Mike dying before Haley and Crystal! Because they were girls!
And so to combat my crazy-ass child brain, I decided to make Crystal into a boy in the BCB world.. and that’s why we have Chris!

69.title: At Loose Ends
69.description: With the help of those who love him, Abbey finds closure for his old family.

author_commentary.veronica:
Hey, everybody! It’s time for a new chapter!
I admit, December was such a monumental and important chapter that I honestly forget there’s two entirely different chapters after it that finish off Volume Three! I guess it’s like how I always forget about “Moving On” because “Love My Way” is such a big climactic story moment that ends Volume One… but it doesn’t.
Anyway, man I really love the colours in this. I feel like I was really on my A-game (for the time) when it came to inking. And storytelling.
And honestly, I was waiting a long time to be able to tell this part of the story, when I felt “artistically” ready for it.
Anyway, let’s go!

Oh man molly why are you so innocently tragic
During my Omnibus commentary run, I’ve been trying to add interesting new information and also removing certain bits that I feel are outdated or uninteresting to readers (like you) binging the archive. I like the idea of the commentary being interesting and fun to read, and not necessarily negative.
At the time I was going through a bad mental spot, and I would have removed reference to that entirely if not for this wonderfully sweet comic by the lovely Rachael Smith! She drew [a really nice comic to cheer me up](http://rachaelsmithillustration.blogspot.com/2012/01/magical-cat.html) at the time and it most certainly brightened me up to see it again.
Thank you so much for drawing such a nice comic for me, so many years ago!
Just let her make her coping gifts, Abbey :( At least her way of coping doesn’t involve punching people lol
Daisy knows how to make someone feel appreciated.
Aww man, Abbey :( You know a party might be a pretty good distraction..
I like Janet.

It’s really nice to see Janet say it’s her responsibility, she’s the adult in this situation and she wants to look out for Abbey. He shouldn’t be putting so much on his shoulders. It’s easy for Abbey to forget he’s just a kid!

Apparently some sites are shutting down for SOPA?
I am a mailman instead
Neither snow, nor rain, nor heat, nor gloom of night, stays these couriers
from the swift delivery of their angsty melodramatic cats

A fun fact I wanted to add regarding the last few pages — I was originally planning for Abbey to go out to look for his mother.
He was supposed to take a bus with Daisy and to bring some cash to book a hotel, and there was meant to be a really silly scene where they’d be stuck in a hotel room with one bed, and Abbey would demand Daisy use it, and Daisy would refuse and tell him to use it, to the point they both eventually passed out on the floor, neither using the bed.
Obviously, not only would this have required a BOATLOAD OF backgrounds and complicated scenes like hotel rooms, busses, etc, it just didn’t feel realistic! You really expect Abbey and Daisy, two teenage kids, going out to another freaken city and figuring out the mystery of what happened to his mother over the course of a few days? Quite ridiculous!
It made more sense for Janet to tell Abbey to just go to his party, she will do the research.
Goodness that sweater looks like it would be really itchy :(
Godspeed, Janet.

Hi all! This page was ready to post a week ago, but it was unprocessed and not yet uploaded to the server. I was able to reconstruct things in order to post an older version, but it took some time to pull the settings out of backup. If you’re interested in the story of the break-in, [I wrote about it in my Tumblr blog](http://su.itca.se/post/16926718661/burgled). Anyway, enjoy the page.
(Out of date commentary now, but interesting, isn’t it? These days I keep my iMac chained to a radiator.)

This chapter is admittedly very personal to me because similar to Abbey, I often get hit with flashbacks and past memories. My brain is always screaming, and sometimes one little thing I see, feel or hear will send me off to recall a much more unpleasant memory.
So Abbey having Janet brushing the back of his head lead him to think back to his mother brushing the back of his head during a very unfortunate conversation, is just a MOOD, you know? A lot of these sequences where he’s flashing back are, for me. This is what Abbey’s head is like a lot of the time!

A new, traditional style for this chapter (and future chapters, if you all like it!) I’m now painting each page with ink and watercolours.
Attentive readers will notice the colour streaking a little on this page and the ones to come. It’s due to our dying scanner, which is no longer able to calibrate itself and is impossible to repair. We’re going to replace it soon, but we’re first trying to see if we can raise money to buy a nice professional scanner that will do a better job.
**UPDATE!!** ~~Nobody gives a shit about bigfoot~~ We raised the money, bought the scanner and updated the site. It looks nicer now.

BCB’s pets have always been the weirdest little element I left in the comic from its older version. I created them as a child.
Sadly, it looks as if they’ve increasingly become a huge problem for some people that try to get into the story? It’s similar to the whole “But why don’t they wear clothes!?!” question, which seems like an odd obsession to me but is genuinely a big obstacle for certain readers.
So I guess I’m doing something about that. The pets were useful characters and often used in the proto-BCB comics none of you saw, but they quickly became obsolete in this reincarnation. They’re with Lucy now.

author_commentary.veronica:
Sue has some good intentions, but still needs to work some biases of her own whoops
Today marks the start of a new style, update schedule, all sorts of stuff. I’m drawing on huge paper, using coloured inks and copic markers as well as trying a few new things with the character designs. Like [On Our Own](http://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c66/p1.html) was back in the day, this chapter is a bit of a style experiment.. so I hope you enjoy as I work things out!

There’s been some colour-changes to the site! Hope you like it and don’t think that your browser is going haywire or something :P IT IS ALL GOOD IN THE HOOD

author_commentary.oliver: Some terribly sad news today — longtime reader of the comic and occasional comment poster / IRC user who went by the name “Insanity Streak” died last Friday. We’ve been in contact with his brother and it’s a shocking, sad thing for us to hear. He was incredibly supportive to us, and went far out of his way to see us at literally every Australian convention we attended except one. He had many little influences on the comic, helping with proofreading our book drafts, sorting comments, and just generally being a super nice guy who was always looking for ways to support this comic. There’s not much a page comment on a webcomic can do to properly memorialise a person, but we wanted to give him a shout-out here in case he’d appreciate it. RIP. We’ll miss you.

author_commentary.oliver: A short intermission this week, concluding Wednesday! But don’t be alarmed, it is definitely a BIG WEEK and we are working madly to get ready for the big draw stream (and other things) on Friday!! So keep your schedules clear for that. See you next update with a minor bombshell. One not about polo a gay.

It’s a problem we’ve all faced.
Come back Friday for a short coda to this intermission (can you do that??) and a **HUGE weekend-long drawing stream** coupled with some major announcements!
But I promised a bombshell today and here it is: **this will be the final day of page comments**.
After we saw only a small part of BCB’s readership posted comments, we thought about how we could build a bigger, better reader community. We wanted to minimise friction and encourage more of the thoughtful, funny comments we’ve always adored from you guys. Many times I worked on new message boards, imageboards, weird new ideas for user commentary — I have some cool mockups scribbled away — but the answer never seemed to be in a new section of the website.
A lot of internet things Vero and I grew up with (Ezboard, DeviantArt groups, site-specific forums, isolated comments systems) are considered old-hat these days, and as tough as it is to admit it, there are many good reasons why that’s the case. **Reader conversations can and should take place in reader-owned spaces** — Twitter, Tumblr, Facebook, personal blogs and other generalised places of discussion. This is how the web works now, and (we think!) it’s for the better.
We’ll facilitate the process where we can. **We’re soon adding a section below each page that’ll help you find conversations and contribute your own.** We’ve worked to stimulate discussion over on Tumblr [with our blog](http://bittersweetcandybowl.tumblr.com/), we’re looking into doing more on Facebook, and we’re always open to talk to you guys [through](http://twitter.com/SuitCase874) [Twitter](http://twitter.com/Taeshi). Notably, **we plan to highlight reader comments we encounter (we’ll keep reading!) and share them prominently when we find them.**
But, ultimately, this is us letting go and handing over the reins to you guys. We believe in you!
A sincere thank you from the two of us for the many years of wonderful comments — don’t stop now!

89.title: Guest of Honor
89.description: Daisy drags Paulo to a comic convention. Abbey would like a word with him.

author_commentary.oliver:
Welcome to a new chapter, and a new style! That’s right, this chapter will be all-digital in a limited palette. It’s the same style you might have seen at [Ask Roseville High](http://askbcb.tumblr.com) lately, but with some refinement.
We want to thank everyone who came over the weekend to watch our marathon drawstream (or, drawathon) which lasted 39 hours over three days. We thank you for all the amazing support, giving us a lot of chat topics, buying a bunch of books, and pledging to [our new Patreon campaign](https://www.patreon.com/bcb). It was a big exhausting success.
Please excuse the state of the BCB site for a little while as we recover from it all. All we really want to communicate today is: check [the Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/bcb) if you haven’t already (all pledges go towards next month’s stream!) and check out [all the weekend’s drawings on Candybooru](http://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/candybooru/post/list/Draw_Stream/1)!
Get off my lawn, nerd.

Whoa! A whole bunch of site updates today. Check the news! Most importantly for you guys, we added a bunch of feedback options so you can comment on pages in consistent places where we can read them! We want to highlight comments we find funny or interesting by putting them on the homepage, so if you have strong opinions about who Paulo should cosplay, let your voice be heard.

Note to all that we’re starting to highlight comments we find on social media, imageboards, chat whatever! So go [talk](http://bcb.cat/c89/p6.html#talk) about the comic and all that, we want to see (and feature!) all your glee and vitriol. Remember that general comments about all of BCB and the chapter are also feature-able, so long as they are short and good!
Joke’s on you, it’s a ren faire. EVEN WORSE!

You know what else is starting today, Paulo? **[Anime Expo](http://anime-expo.org)!** We’re just getting out of LAX now, and will be setting up our table tonight! Come see us Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday in the **Artists Alley, table B104** — it’s our first time in LA and may be the only time we visit the west coast!

WHAT A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE IT IS TO ATTEND A CONVENTION IN SUNNY ~~ROSEVILLE~~ **LOS ANGELES.** WHAT EXCITING ESCAPADES WILL ~~DAISY AND PAULO~~ **VERONICA AND OLIVER** EXPERIENCE NEXT? (We’re at [Anime Expo](http://anime-expo.org) this weekend, the biggest anime con of all! Come visit us at Artists Alley table B104! I’m not sure if this is some kind of tradition among anime cons, but we first saw the “Anime Hot Dog” at Anime Boston last year and thought anime food had to be a part of this food truck. And yes, it was just a regular hot dog.
Don’t forget, you too can get overpriced junk food at [ConnectiCon](http://connecticon.org/) this weekend! We’re there Friday to Sunday, so everyone in the northeast, please come see us!

I often play the Paulo to Vero’s Daisy in crowded situations like this. If you’ve ever tried to walk through Times Square as a timid, polite person, you’ll know that feel.
In fact, the best example of this was at New York Comic Con last year. Walk-in seller booths become islands of sanity surrounded by seas of sweaty people. FORGE ON OR BE SWEPT AWAY.
That said, come see as at [ConnectiCon](http://connecticon.org/)! We’re there all weekend, come see us along the wall in the main dealers hall with all the other online media guests! Take refuge. Buy a necklace.

Back when Veronica attended a few cons (back in Australia, Animania represent!) in cosplay this was a little bit of a common experience. Although Vero’s characters were rarely as popular as Daisy’s character seems to be. Nobody has any respect for [Kotonoha](http://overflow.wikia.com/wiki/Kotonoha) and [Alicia](http://valkyria.wikia.com/wiki/Alicia_Melchiott_(VC1)) desu.
Thanks for the warm reception at ConnectiCon! We love you all! Pledge and come along to the stream for a chance at your very own little drawing! And maybe we’ll entertain you.

Here’s the big change! And to a new reader… it’s nothing?
Basically, the big deal is that the rest of the chapter looks like THIS and not like a BCI comic. In late 2015 when this chapter was posted, Veronica was still getting used to the new style introduced in Guest of Honor, we had scheduled a holiday where she wouldn’t be able to work on new pages, and the buffer was about to run out. So the solution was found: update at the normal rate, but finish Golden Hour in the sketchy BCI style that’s way quicker.
Obviously, we knew we had to get around to finishing it in the proper style in time for Volume Six, and so in late 2018 Veronica spent a bit over a month finishing all twenty-five pages. Hidden work goes into every book we publish (for example, all the drawing corrections made for Volumes Four and Five required a lot of work from both of us, as patching over watercolour is a lot more complex) and the hidden work in Volume Six involved redrawing 25 pages everyone already read. Two months of page updates, two months that could otherwise go into the page buffer and avoid hiatuses and update schedule changes, but two months that had to be spent!
So for old readers, while you might have already read these pages, please enjoy the changes!
For new readers, it’s like nothing ever happened! We hope.
As a bonus: check out [a comparison of this page to the older style,](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/misc/90-18-comparison.gif) and [a comparison of page 28 to the older style](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/misc/90-28-comparison.gif).

Hey guys!!! Welcome to the new chapter!! This will be a pretty fun one where absolutely nothing will go wrong!! :) HOPE YOU ENJOY IT!!!

author_commentary.oliver:
Every once in a while we update the online comic archive with all the art and dialogue edits from our newest book. For Volume Four, I never got around to it! But this weekend, I finally did, along with Volume Five! So if you want to re-read from [Piece of Cake](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c70/p1.html) to [Class of 2008](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c88/p1.html) (literally, all the watercolour comics) you’ll see hundreds of changes, although if we did our job well none will be too noticeable. Most notably, the first half of Volume Five now has outlines around speech bubbles, which was a whole lot of work but now it’s done. Otherwise, it’s the product of our frenzied readings and re-readings in the leadup to printing, and represents something made a little better with a couple years of hindsight.
You can see everything on the new, improved [Archive page](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/archive.html)! Where yes, finally, Volume Four and Five get their own section. It’s all a little tidied up (and now mobile-friendly.) BINGE SOME OLD COMICS TODAY.

There’s this old magical girl Lucy comic I drew when I was 14 or so where a lot of the story took place at a campsite so she was wearing a white shirt and bike-shorts-ish pants as a uniform, like how Stacy is dressed in the third panel here. It’s a very cute look! Clearly inspired by [the gym clothes in Cardcaptor Sakura](https://ccsakura.fandom.com/wiki/Tomoeda_Elementary_School_Uniforms#Summer_P.E_Uniform).
I’ve admittedly considered dressing the BCB crew in that kind of gear when they would go to gym since I remember I had to change to gym clothes back in High School. But I know dressing them up would create annoying “wHy DoN’t ThEy WeAr ClOtHeS oUtSiDe Of GyM cLaSs” remarks which has DEMOTIVATED me from doing it!!!
Less for me to draw at least!!
(Katie and Stacy normally wear clothes, though, so reasonably they would change into uniforms.)
Just imagine, if they were humans they’d *have* to switch into gym clothes during gym and not actually wear what they went to school with. Getting your normal clothes all sweaty… fughfgkhfgk

I tried to recall a time when Abbey and Paulo have been friendly and I can literally only remember the summer vacation arc where Paulo gave Abbey a gay VHS as an early birthday present, to make fun of him. Paulo’s first two lines make me laugh every time, he’s so SINCERE! Sometimes you just CAN’T like someone and you will NEVER get along with them! It just happens!! In another world if they weren’t sharing a high school and a group of friends they would never have a reason to speak to each other at all.
But… Paulo’s remorse is sincere.

author_commentary.oliver: Don’t worry. I got to see the principal often enough, and was suspended at least once. I will bring the delinquent experience we need

author_commentary.veronica: I always laugh at Abbey’s first remark here. Straight after listening to Paulo agonise over his job… it’s so shockingly cruel!

PAULO WHY ARE YOU PUTTING YOUR FEET ON THE COUCH
THIS IS WHY NO ONE LIKES YOU

Of course “you’re lazy” is added alongside some actually horrible attributes.
“You’re a murderer, you’re a war criminal, you jaywalked!”
I do heavily empathise with Abbey here. I remember being in communities where I was the known borderline bitch who had to keep herself in check, and I would frequently get frustrated by similarly mentally-unwell people having public meltdowns and not getting as much ire as I would if I acted similarly. I guess it’s because people expected better of me? I was way more self-aware and trying my best not to “act out”. Which is flattering but also very frustrating in the moment.
No comment.

This sequence always makes me cry, especially because Paulo had all this in the back of his head all along. He’s just not the kind of person to talk about it!! At all! Even to his closest friends!
Imagine just bottling this up for years, and not feeling confident in yourself enough to share it with anyone. Instead Paulo just acts like everything’s cool and makes petty dead-mom jokes. Always forgiving, always trying not to “incite drama”, always hurting.
Even now Abbey trying to reach out makes him recoil.

This has just rocked Abbey’s world.
“Moms can be… bad????”
“Moms can be CRUEL??!?!!??! does not… compute”
Paulo I’m pretty sure if you gave Abbey a concussion you’d have A LOT more to worry about, be glad your throw was weak as piss (according to Abbey)

It was me. I was the fucking nerd.
I was the worst at sports, but I still tried my best in gym for that sweet sweet participation credit. It was 25% of your grade!!! Easy enough, right?

Thank you everyone for reading!!!
This chapter ends so warmly, colour-wise, like a lovely creamsicle.

Hey, everybody!! It’s time to leave the previous December-era flashback and jump straight to the present, four seasons later!
Goodness, wouldn’t this intro have sucked if I was updating once a week ;) BUT NOPE, YOU’LL GET A STUPIDLY LONG CHAPTER IN A.. more tolerable dripfeed. I hope you enjoy!!!
This is a very big chapter (the longest in BCB history!) I’ve long planned… keep checking back every Monday, Wednesday and Friday!

As I write this commentary, I have just come home from a Pokemon Go community day that took place when it was extremely snowy. There’s something very relatable about trying to read over a message as snowflakes land on the phone, momentarily melting into water droplets that pool together. SO ANNOYING TO WIPE.
Better put that phone away before it gets water-damaged and Mike has to head to the genius bar, lol

Paulo, you could just.. not say anything, you know. You worry too much, you lovesick boy.
I considered giving Lucy more of a chipper expression in the second panel because I didn’t want her to seem generically apathetic to Daisy, but let’s be real. She’d totally be tuning out 70% of Daisy’s blathering :-[ She’s probably just going on about some TV show Lucy has zero interest in and Daisy’s certain she needs to hear all the juicy details of season four. Without any background information. Just assuming Lucy can read her mind. We’ve all been there. I’ve been Daisy plenty of times, myself.
"Dammit, Paulo, being sad and remorseful isn’t allowing me to be an asshole like I wanna! >8( That’s not fair!"
I can see Daisy really struggling with pre-Skype era long-distance relationships. She really just wants someone close to talk to ;\_;
Well, does it??
PERHAPS.

114.title: Double Down
114.description: Put yourself first every once in a while.

author_commentary.veronica:
HEY, EVERYONE!!!! IT’S TIME FOR A NEW CHAPTER!! And boy is it a big one…
As this chapter went through the editing process, each segment was revised and revised got longer and longer… HOPEFULLY I DON’T RETROACTIVELY ADD ANOTHER IN CASE IT ACCIDENTALLY BECOMES LONGER THAN ETERNAL FLAME!!
Anyway Lucy isn’t that much of a morning person, but Augustus absolutely is. Kind of by force.
WOW JORDAN WAY TO NOT INVITE LUCY AS WELL. Model brother right there.
Get those legs toned, Lucy! Jordan’s actually looking out for you and not being a careless idiot brother as usual!!! I’m sure!!!!!!!

So much for being selfless!
That’s a familiar look.
It’s true.
An exhausting day already.

Talk about school getting in the way of a mental breakdown.
IN OTHER NEWS SOUPPY AND I HAVE BEEN TOGETHER FOR 19 YEARS TODAY!!! ON THIS DAY!!! WHOAAAAA!!
MIKE AND LUCY WISH THEY HAD OUR LOVE!!!!! what are they waiting for!!
But no seriously Souppy is the light of my life and I love him and he’s always the best to be around and I love just hanging out with him and talking to him about anything and gossiping and laughing and chatting and debating and having lots of delicious onions together. My editor, my husband, my love!!
I love you, Souppy!!!! You are the best quarantine partner to have around!

Souppy and I had a big argument about this page because I really wanted to show Mike’s mind racing with anxiety and embarrassment and self-hatred, but he thought if all the dialogue was removed, it would still depict the same feelings! Clearly he doesn’t know what it’s like to be MENTALLY ILL LMAO
Having that brain screaming at you and all. We did end up toning it down and trying to make it less.. spoon-feedy? His monologue was definitely more on-the-nose originally, but I still wanted to show he’s absolutely panicking and feeling completely alone as his mind is completely blanking out.
author_commentary.oliver: So often I think Vero conveys a feeling visually (using the medium of comics!) but then she chickens out and adds words on top of the highly communicative art!! This was one of those times, but on a second readthrough, in context I think this amount of inner voice is perfectly fine.

115.2.title: On Call
115.2.description: The rest of the phone call on that fateful night.

author_commentary.veronica:
Hey, everyoneeeeee!! It’s time for.. uhh.. a new chapter. That is not quite a chapter.. and not quite an intermission..
I’ve been musing about this sequence a lot! This is actually supposed to be a canonical conversation that took place in Eternal Flame after Mike came back from seeing Lucy, but at the time I was REALLY fatigued by there being not one, but TWO phone conversations in the chapter already.. and I kinda liked the mystery.
I sorta wanted the information of this call to spill out in the following chapters as a result of me omitting it.. for the readers to pick up the pieces over time.
And that’s why these pages are done in the BCI style rather than made into actual pages. I don’t plan to redraw this to insert into Eternal Flame! This is an optional extra. I still want to tell the story by having information come out over time (and much already has!)
Kinda show don’t tell in a way.. though there’ll be plenty of telling since a lot of this involves Sandy having to talk on the phone LOL
So why am I posting this sequence? Well, I think it’s a fun sequence now that I had time to think it over and polish it up into comic form! It’s wayyyy more fleshed out than [the draft version that was posted on Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/posts/55061426) (Join for more cool bonuses like that.. there’s other sequences I’ve canned before and put up there… i can also draw you birthday requests)
And the OTHER reason is that I’m traveling a lot so I needed an excuse to create quick buffer because the next chapter is going to involve a lot of complicated mall backgrounds HAHAHAHAHAH
But I think people will enjoy seeing a little more of Sandy come out here!
I do really like this sequence now that I properly revised it. It’s really hard to make a conversation look dynamic and I take different angles overtime every time. A phone call is a solid challenge!
oh right sandy cheated on mike… he should still kinda be sore about that…
Mike shoulda turned the correct way on panel 4 but WHATEVER MAN HE JUST TURNED AGAIN. That’s my story and I’m sticking to it.

It’s funny how in previous revisions Mike was more of a doormat around Sandy, but writing it this time around.. Mike was just leading me in the direction that he’s *sore* about this! He’s feeling betrayed!! All his waiting has been for nought because she’s been spending all this time with someone else! The egg is on Mike’s face! So I couldn’t write him as a complete doormat, it just wasn’t feeling that way for me.
Sandy’s not-so-perfect life.
Isn’t that familiar!
I love Sandy’s tactfulness.
Hitting him where it HURTS, Sandy is good.
Little a cheating.. as a treat.
It sucks when a person crying makes you start crying as well dkhfkdhfgkdhgdg that happens to me all the time

I like how Mike is implying that it’s not like HE has to change.. which I mean… in the case of Sandy, it’s kinda true…
He certainly should be changing for the friends around him who have to deal with his lonely tantrums, but Sandy? He woulda gladly been at her beck and call before!

Sometimes I feel guilty when someone decides to do something bold for me.. like no, i didn’t deserve that..
also yeah i guess a person’s job was on the line WHOOPS
yeowch

Mike so good at hearing he can still hear her talking in the last panel even though the phone is on the bed lol
(I genuinely did that on purpose because I know Mike’d be able to hear)
Might as well give this another go.

Thanks for reading!!!!
I enjoyed exploring this sequence. The chapters ahead will do all of the heavy lifting to make this chapter more of an extra than a must-read extra, of course - but at least you all know how it went down!

author_commentary.veronica:
Hello everyoooooone!!

ANYWAY Souppy and I have been VERY BUSY (And we also returned from a four-week family trip that uhhhhhh… involved my buffer getting murdered before my eyes) and I’m still working on the next chapter (Pretty far into it too!), but the buffer feels a little too weak FOR MY LIKING…

One thing that I find fun about making new characters is that a lot of the time I have the super basic personality down, but then I start making up stuff in my head? Like “oh, wouldn’t this be interesting”
Like when I introduced Matt, he was just “Rachel’s friend” and was meant to be an excitable gentle giant.. but then I was like.. what if I made him gay.
Which then leaned into.. what if he has feelings for Jordan. And the ideas just kept pouring out. In some ways I am discovering new things about some new characters at the same time as Mike.
Anyway I developed a background in my head about Felix and James so that’ll be a fun thing to tackle in the future!

Hello and welcome to a new chapter!!!! Wow!!!!
Or is it new… technically it shouldn’t be.
Souppy and I have been slowly working on Omnibus 2 (secret revealed!) and we are taking opportunities to fix little things that have bugged me about the story. With Omnibus 1, as you know, it was a lot. Omnibus 2 doesn’t need as much of that kind of tweaking, thankfully! I’m pretty happy with Volumes 4-6! HOWEVER…
After rereading Volume Six, I found some issues in the arc where Paulo gives Daisy the silent treatment. Admittedly, around the time those chapters were written, I was already planning Lucy’s return, and I got so fixated and excited about bringing Lucy back to the story that I got impatient.. and as a result, I kind of neglected this storyline! Plus there were so many Paulo-centric chapters before Volume Six, and I technically had to draw [“Golden Hour”](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c90/p1) twice because of how it was initially posted in sketch form… so man, I was getting a little sick of writing about him. I wanted Lucy back! I wanted Lucy to cause some chaos, challenge the dynamics of the group! That was exciting to me!
So I wrapped up that thread a bit too quickly.. and as a result, the arc didn’t develop as well as I wanted it. Why was Paulo so mad at Daisy? I think it makes sense if you read between the lines, but it was all too subtle. It’s not crazy to wonder: how come he ignored Daisy when they returned to school, right after having had such a meaningful important conversation with Matt? Didn’t that conversation tell Paulo know that he’s capable of good? How come he went back to his old womanising habits?
I justified it in my head that Paulo spent summer vacation stewing about [the phone call with Daisy,](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c90/p11) feeling wronged by her, but also being fearful of being around Daisy because of Abbey. Paulo was genuinely scared of Abbey. Perhaps becoming what Abbey expects of him (a womanising jerk) will finally get Daisy off his back for good. She implied he is capable of cruelty, after all! Why not give that to her? Daisy can then leave him alone, and so Abbey won’t threaten him anymore. Two birds, one stone, right?
Some readers have kind of determined that was what was going on in his head - but this is too much stuff that wasn’t shown. And that’s why this chapter is being made! To bolster the weakest part of the story.
This chapter is supposed to take place between [“Ice Block”](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c90.1/p1) and [“Dial Tone.”](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c91/p1) It will be inserted further back in the archive once Omnibus 2 is ready, but for now it runs as a new chapter.
Anyway, that’s enough of me babbling! I hope you enjoy this chapter! I tried my best to emulate the Volume Six style, so enjoy a blast from the past!
The way some things change (being a second player), the more they stay the same (the second player being a sore loser lol).

I bet so many people are excited that we’ll get to see the nerds doing nerd things again!!!!!
I’m Paulo, on the other hand.
QUICK, HIDE.
Happy pride month… with someone becoming closeted sorry--

Haley is irritated at being interrupted from her precious computer time, but is secretly wishing she could stay and witness the extreme awkwardness that is about to ensue.
Just join their guild, it’s not too late!
You’re not a guild member!
The advantage of making a chapter that takes place in the past is that I can play with old dynamics again.. like Abbey and Daisy still dating :)
Paulo continues to be me.
Paulo’s gonna be BEGGING for a SwordsVale account in NO TIME!
They have been having a VERY productive day.
Not the P-word! Anything but the P-word!!!
Honesty??
Smooth!
Paulo stans vs Paulo haters, fight!
C’mon, don’t be shy!
Gotta keep hedging for your bestie… can’t help herself…
You gotta be a little meaner… put some heart into it.
Mike will never live it down.
You have made a compelling argument!
Atta girl!

it’s like catching a glimpse of a nasty group chat
anyway lol stacy
YEAH THAT WAS GREAT HAHAHAHA NO CONSEQUENCES WILL COME OF THIS HAHAHAHAHAHA
Guess Daisy won’t be a guild member after all..
yeah how’s he going
I can’t believe Amaya said all those things about me! That hurt most of all!!
Mike’s trying so hard, man. You just gotta love the little loser.
Bye!
Ahh, that’s a more comfortable feeling to have.
No don’t be sad, be mad again!! Be really really mad!
ooh hello there

man rachel deserved so much better
And that’s the end of the chapter, thank you for reading!! We will be going back to the future with our next chapter, 121!! Stay tuned!
Hello and welcome to the next chapter!!! Who is this girl and what is she up to!
Rina sounding like she’s straight out of a 90s sitcom, just pressing that same funny button over and over. You know her archetype! You know what she’s here for!
This sounds like a whole load of mondo bad stuff, June!
Ahh, the true villain is here.. a landlord
This sure is escalating!
“Big brother” always reads out to me in Mokuba’s voice… I cannot unhear Albert’s dialogue for that reason.
Not a harlot!! Anything but a harlot!!
He didn’t even walk over and give June her phone back! This dude’s EVIL…

This is the part of the story where the heroine has hit rock bottom. Everything is super bad, and you feel super bad about it, and you sure hope that something fortunate happens to the plucky protagonist. Will it?
Haha! Dating lots of people!! Hahaha!!
Don’t knock it til you’ve tried it!!!
Who is this..
The light.. of Ms. Lumin’s life…
Great play, Jessica! Thanks for not trying to force two warring ex-friends to make up through theatre!
They’re just girl names, right?
Matt is trying his best!
Boy, don’t you feel silly now, Rachel!
Look, representing you as a whore and a coward was a COMPLIMENT, okay? Some people don’t even get to BE in these plays!
Nobody is here to defend Tess being… slightly exaggerated. That one’s a-okay with the group it seems.
Jordan really is such a sweetheart.. he’s too dopey to notice his own doppelgänger. The boy’s got a heart of gold, fighting for his friends (his love interest) instead!
Hey, it’s [these girls!](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c61/p33) It’s been a while!
Being nice is LAME, Matt! Come on, get with the times!
In this alternate universe where the seniors fight, Madison is actually the most level-headed in the group.
And that’s the end!! Thanks for reading!! I’m sure they’ll all work it out.

Hello, everybody!! Welcome to the new chapter! Let’s forget the seniors for now (they’ll be fine) and see what our main girls are up to… perhaps it’ll be something good!
I had fun designing Daisy’s locker. I was always such a boring sort when it came to my own locker back in High School.. what’s the point of putting stuff in it if it wasn’t going to permanently belong to me? Daisy is not me, though, and I can imagine her splashing out to give her locker some personality. That’s why she did much better at school than me!
Back to zoning out again. [A familiar situation, isn’t it?](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c25/p1)
Guess you gotta let her keep having those intrusive thoughts.

Daisy being all sad and lovesick, when I was doing mile runs I was creating AMVs in my head of my OCs!!!
.. who happened to be the BCB characters LMAO, goodness they’ve existed a long time!

Lucy’s winning streak of being over boys is very vast and long!!
.. Well, I mean she did technically get over Paulo. That’s one!
Lucy is sick of her very predictable stupid friends.
Paulo standing there like “Wow, the last time I properly interacted with Lucy, I told her she was sleeping around with Augustus, what could possibly go wrong?"
These two girls haaaaaate me!
Put some money in the tip jar while you’re at it, Lucy!
Hey, it’s not like Lucy brought Tess or Rachel over.. plenty of blunders you don’t have to think about lol
Why even bother doing this, what’s the point, what’s she even done for me.
Paulo seems to have a type.. a type that you definitely are not.
“I want my beloved to be happy” is for losers and quitters!

At least you know, Lucy, yes!! Even after.. \*gestures\* all of that. That happened.
.. yeah perhaps daisy has a point lol
Leaving a perfectly good milkshake behind.
Lucy the matchmaker strikes again and takes no prisoners.
At least the rain will hide your tears.

Deep breaths.
Maybe Abbey helped her after all.
There he is.
Wait my mascara is running, waaaaaitttt!!!
You catastrophising FOOL!
Oh, if only.
Still there, for some reason.
Give me the bad news, already! Just put me out of my misery!
asufsfdhgkhdg
author_commentary.news: NEW BCI COMIC TODAY NEW BCI COMIC TODAY! “Two-time Love” is 28 pages of Daisy getting [a different pair of sweethearts in a very different context!](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/store/bci.html)

author_commentary.veronica: Daisy is like one of those cats after you’ve overstimulated them too much, just brushed them a wee bit too long. Can’t contain herself.
A hug to not be embarrassed about anymore.
Miranda is going to be SEETHING!
It’s truly hitting her!
When has he ever gotten this kind of attention..

Greater..
Like Abbey.
Already spousal abuse going on >8U
Off they go.
Thank you for reading!! The milkshake didn’t go to waste, thankfully! That was the most important part.

bci.title: Blind Date
bci.description: As Rachel begs to get in his pants, Matt struggles to figure out how to navigate the dating scene when you aren’t really pining for a cute girl.

bci.title: Everyday Life
bci.description: Five characters, five pages each. A little view into Roseville High right before the return of Lucy.

bci.title: Grave Concern
bci.description: Lucy didn’t survive the jump, and she’s not about to let Mike forget it.

bci.title: Sweet Dreams
bci.description: Molly’s really really sick, and everyone’s counting on a certain sweet voice to soothe her.

bci.title: Molly’s Adventure
bci.description: Anxious to play saleswoman for a day, Molly’s choice to seize the moment (and a friend) proves both a blessing and a curse.

bci.title: Another Path
bci.description: Paulo daydreams about a romantic rendezvous with Lucy. Where could it lead…?

bci.title: Magic Tricks
bci.description: When David’s dark wizardry causes accidental body swaps, discoveries are made, photos are taken and, uh.

bci.title: Disaster Dominoes
bci.description: Five years later and it’s still the most awful thing. Everything has gone wrong in Roseville.

bci.title: Another Chance
bci.description: What if Abbey never interrupted Augustus’ forced kiss?

bci.title: Door to Door
bci.description: Molly enlists her brother to sell cookies with her. Awkward encounters with Mike, Daisy and Paulo result.

bci.title: Accidents Will Happen
bci.description: A one-night stand with Augustus has bigger consequences than Daisy ever expected.

bci.title: Mostly Harmless
bci.description: Some hypothetical kittens have fun catching bugs. The next generation of shipping.

bci.title: Another Kiss
bci.description: After [“Aftermath”](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c15/p1), Lucy’s kiss could have lead somewhere deeper.

bci.title: First Dance
bci.description: Paulo and Daisy hatch a plan. Hey, it’s just like that episode of The Simpsons!

bci.title: In Deep
bci.description: Lucy catches Paulo in the bath, and he does his best to make the most of the situation. In a thoughtful way!!

bci.title: Picture Perfect
bci.description: A static version of the once-interactive comic that came with the BCB iPhone app.

bci.title: Promise
bci.description: Young Mike and Sandy are approaching the end of their time together, so together they make a promise.

bci.title: Family Comix
bci.description: Lucy, Daisy, Paulo, Mike and Sue appear in a few scenes from home (and work!) with their families.

bci.title: Christmas Dinner
bci.description: Dear Santa, all I want for Christmas is these two cats under the mistletoe. Part of the Another Path storyline.

bci.title: Store Credit
bci.description: It’s Haley’s birthday, and Paulo takes Mike out to go gift shopping. Sparks fly!

bci.title: Baby Blues
bci.description: Young Daisy has a pregnancy scare. Mike’s gonna be a father!

bci.title: Another December
bci.description: What if Lucy came to Paulo after the events of “December”? Part of the Another Path storyline.

bci.title: Another Boyfriend
bci.description: In the not too distant future, Mike and Lucy are going behind Paulo’s back. How’s he gonna take it?

bci.title: Fork in the Road
bci.description: A three-part tragedy. Mike reunites with Lucy for a night of passion, but there’s a storm coming.

bci.title: Love Letters
bci.description: Madison’s got a little crush. Not that you’d ever figure her feelings out.

bci.title: Augustus, You Jerk #2
bci.description: Augustus doing what he does best. Boom, roasted!

bci.title: Magical Girl Redux
bci.description: A retold fragment of the pre-BCB Magical Girl Lucy story back when Veronica was an anime.

bci.title: Play Date
bci.description: What if Augustus was a little younger and grew up alongside Lucy?

bci.title: Blood Lust
bci.description: So, uh, Mike is a vampire. It is literally about that.

bci.title: Candied Bacon
bci.description: The school’s going hog wild for Jessica’s treats at the bake sale! Can Daisy save these pigs from the slaughter?

bci.title: Sob Story
bci.description: Sue needs an interview subject. Augustus obliges when Paulo doesn’t.

bci.title: Out of Ideas
bci.description: Molly is tasked with making a great BCI for you all.

bci.title: Photo Day
bci.description: Daisy wakes up with the worst look imaginable.

bci.title: Ice Breaker
bci.description: Sue gives Paulo some much-needed lessons in conversational etiquette.

bci.title: Merry Christmas, Roseville!
bci.description: With his guardian angel’s guidance, Mike witnesses just how wonderful life in Roseville would be without him.

bci.title: Elementary School Sweethearts
bci.description: What if Sandy never moved away from Roseville? Life would be awfully different… Well, maybe just awful.

bci.title: A Better You
bci.description: Daisy’s future self pays Roseville High a visit. She’s got some serious wisdom to share.

bci.title: Another Intervention
bci.description: What if, on that fateful night, Augustus was already on the roof?

bci.title: Essential Worker
bci.description: It’s Take Your Child To Work Day, and Daisy’s excited to visit her dad. Who’s... some kind of magical guardian?!

bci.title: Another Perspective
bci.description: What if Daisy was standing atop the hill after Mike’s breakup with Sandy?

bci.title: Another Rescue
bci.description: What if Paulo fell off the bridge during summer vacation?

bci.title: Another Direction
bci.description: What if Mike took James up on his “Date Night” offer?

bci.title: Another Date
bci.description: What if Paulo won the race for a date with James?

bci.title: Pen Pals
bci.description: Third-grade Mike leaves for another city. Two girls bond over writing him letters.

bci.title: Another Choice
bci.description: Mike could have dropped Sandy. He could have said yes. The first time.

bci.title: Another Way
bci.description: What if Daisy followed Augustus’s guide to seduce Mike... and won him over?

bci.title: Two-time Love
bci.description: Daisy gets the Mike and Sandy she always wanted.

book_exclusive.title: Curtain Rising
book_exclusive.description: As Sue frets backstage, Jessica pops in for a final word of encouragement.

book_exclusive.title: No Service
book_exclusive.description: While his messages go unanswered, Mike never has to worry about losing touch with a certain pair.

book_exclusive.title: Critical Eye
book_exclusive.description: Chastened by Paulo, Sue tries to connect with Paulo’s interests. For a moment.

book_exclusive.title: Payback
book_exclusive.description: Jasmine, Mina and Cassidy take a trip to the movie theater, sponsored by a guilt-ridden patron.

book_exclusive.title: Fashion Disaster
book_exclusive.description: Don’t ask a girl in cheerleader mode about her MMORPG.

book_exclusive.title: There’s a Chance
book_exclusive.description: Roxy thanks Jordan for a great night at prom, but he’s not about to learn a thing.

book_exclusive.title: Afterglow
book_exclusive.description: Rachel’s friends-with-benefits arrangement with Paulo is fraying at the seams, but she puts on a happy face.

book_exclusive.title: Unpacking Day
book_exclusive.description: Lucy’s back home. While her mom sees a chance to reach out, Lucy isn’t interested in her advice.

candybooru.title: Birthday Melody
candybooru.description: David cheers on Lucy with a song that strikes deep in her lovestruck heart.

candybooru.title: Talk Like a Pirate
candybooru.description: Pirate puns with a sharp hook.

candybooru.title: Natural Instincts
candybooru.description: Yashy wonders if these cats really do do anything cat-like. Mike’s ready to oblige.

candybooru.title: Bus Stop
candybooru.description: Lucy is late because the bus is late and she’s about ready to bite somebody’s head off.

candybooru.title: Preschool Terror
candybooru.description: An early appearance of the kittens! And one’s a real bully.

candybooru.title: Search for Treasure
candybooru.description: Young Mike goes searching for Sandy’s missing ribbon, but really hurts his brain.

candybooru.title: ’Til Death Do Us Part
candybooru.description: Daisy helps Paulo practice his romantic writing.

candybooru.title: Friendship Day
candybooru.description: On this most special day of the year, Daisy’s eager to distribute extra-meaningful literary gifts.

candybooru.title: Boy with the Funny Name
candybooru.description: How come everybody except Paulo gets a Daisy nickname?!

candybooru.title: A Robot Cat
candybooru.description: An obedient cat-droid relentlessly pursues Lucy, a little bit like Paulo.

candybooru.title: Bittersweet Style Experiment
candybooru.description: We finally sell out to the furries, but the cast isn’t about to take it without a fight.

candybooru.title: Welcome to Burger-Tron
candybooru.description: A prototypical appearance of Paulo’s fast food job.

candybooru.title: Augustus You Jerk
candybooru.description: He really just says whatever he likes to ruin your day.

candybooru.title: Cardcaptor Rachel
candybooru.description: Jessica can’t get Rachel’s magical wing pins out of her head.

candybooru.title: Snowy Summer Vacation
candybooru.description: Posted when Summer Vacation arc took a lot longer than Summer itself.

candybooru.title: Sue’s Interview
candybooru.description: Sue reports on a frequent reader question and gets a fairly blunt answer.

candybooru.title: Love Scene
candybooru.description: A mushy little thing between Mike and Lucy that didn’t happen.

candybooru.title: April Fools’ 2011 (Pillow Talk)
candybooru.description: A violent conclusion to “Pillow Talk”, posted as a page update on David’s appearance under the bed.

candybooru.title: April Fools’ 2015 (Paulo Tales)
candybooru.description: A total site takeover to reflect the new star of the show — your favorite orange Somali!

candybooru.title: Kickstarter Promo 2017
candybooru.description: A special update promoting the new Kickstarter and the debut of the Daisy plush. Who better a customer than Abbey?

candybooru.title: Kickstarter Promo 2018 (Fair Game)
candybooru.description: Sandy interrupts a meaningful moment between Paulo and Matt in “Fair Game” to sell her Kickstarter.

candybooru.title: April Fools’ 2019 (Witch Hunt)
candybooru.description: After breaking off from Mike in “Witch Hunt”, Augustus deters Daisy from selling us on the wonderful benefits of Volume Six. With a bullet.

graveyard.title: Unfulfilled dayyyy
graveyard.description: BCB’s first chapter. It was a bit aimless, so [Simple Pleasures](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c1/p1) replaced it.

graveyard.title: The Burden of Parenthood (Original version)
graveyard.description: Replaced with [an updated version](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c5/p1) after the release of Volume One.

graveyard.title: Up to Bat
graveyard.description: You guessed it: baseball. [We reused the title here.](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c56/p1)

graveyard.title: Chirpy’s Introduction
graveyard.description: A chapter for Chirpy! Once absent from the archive entirely, it was brought back with the remake [“Flying Lessons”](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c6/p1) in 2021.

graveyard.title: Unfinished Abbey Chapter
graveyard.description: Originally planned to follow “Moving On”, this story was later covered in [At Loose Ends](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c69/p1).

graveyard.title: Hydrothunder Tantrum
graveyard.description: Mike and Lucy catch pocket monsters. Removed from the archive after the release of the first Omnibus.

graveyard.title: Like a Bittersweet Candy Bowl
graveyard.description: A fourth-wall-breaking introduction to Volume One and the world of BCB.

graveyard.title: Sweet Surprises
graveyard.description: Everyone’s just itching to try the new gumball machine. A Volume One exclusive, removed from the archive after the release of the first Omnibus.

graveyard.title: Dinner Time
graveyard.description: Squabbling over the kitchen table, we see a glimpse of Lucy’s home life. Remade in 2020 and [now part of the comic archive](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c65/p1).

graveyard.title: Starting Over
graveyard.description: Jessica and Rachel get to know the cast. An abandoned attempt to summarize the story for new readers picking up Volume Two.

graveyard.title: Another Plan
graveyard.description: A speculative bonus chapter that was published during the comic’s “holiday break”.

graveyard.title: Another Trip
graveyard.description: What if Lucy followed Augustus home to the wrong side of the tracks? Member-only comic repurposed in 2018 for a long sequence in [“Escape Route”](https://www.bittersweetcandybowl.com/c102/p1).
